prognosis: The action of fluorouracil cream means that some degree of itch, pain, erosions, crusting , dermatitis and other inflammatory reactions are expected during treatment. The following complications may occasionally occur during fluorouracil cream treatment. Excessive local inflammatory reaction may cause ulceration, blistering and local swelling. Phototoxic reactions develop on treated areas exposed to sunlight or another source of ultraviolet radiation. Hypersensitivity reactions are a particular risk for patients with dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase enzyme deficiency, who may also develop systemic toxicity. Systemic symptoms may include fever , nausea, diarrhoea, headache and mouth ulcers ( stomatitis ). Blood tests may show leukocytosis (raised white cell count) or leukopenia (reduced white cell count). Irritant contact dermatitis or allergic contact dermatitis may affect some or all treated areas, including skin that is not sun damaged. The cause can be the 5-FU itself, a preservative (eg parabens ) or an excipient in the cream (stearyl alcohol, propylene glycol). Secondary infection ( impetiginisation ) can occur due to bacteria penetrating eroded skin. The following complications may follow fluorouracil cream treatment: Persistent white marks or scarring Undiagnosed skin cancers ; ­ these may appear to heal with fluorouracil cream but recur later.

prognosis_zh: 氟尿嘧啶乳膏的作用意味著在治療過程中預計會出現一定程度的瘙癢、疼痛、糜爛、結痂、皮炎和其他炎症反應。氟尿嘧啶乳膏治療期間偶爾可能會出現以下並發症。局部過度炎症反應可能會引起潰爛、水皰和局部腫脹。暴露於陽光或其他紫外線輻射源的治療區域會發生光毒性反應。對於二氫嘧啶脫氫酶缺乏的患者來說，過敏反應是一個特別的風險，他們還可能出現全身毒性。全身症狀可能包括發燒、噁心、腹瀉、頭痛和口腔潰瘍（口腔炎）。血液檢查可能顯示白細胞增多（白細胞計數升高）或白細胞減少（白細胞計數減少）。刺激性接觸性皮炎或過敏性接觸性皮炎可能會影響部分或所有治療區域，包括未曬傷的皮膚。原因可能是5-FU本身、防腐劑（例如對羥基苯甲酸酯）或乳膏中的賦形劑（硬脂醇、丙二醇）。由於細菌侵入受侵蝕的皮膚，可能會發生繼發感染（膿皰化）。氟尿嘧啶乳膏治療後可能會出現以下並發症： 持續性白斑或疤痕 未確診的皮膚癌；使用氟尿嘧啶乳膏可能會治愈這些症狀，但隨後又會復發。

title: Acanthosis nigricans
snippet: Acanthosis nigricans is characterised by symmetric, thickened, brown, velvety patches and plaques that appear most commonly in the intertriginous areas (ie, the axillae, groin, and back and sides of the neck). In women, the nipples and areolae of the breasts, the vulva , and the perineum may also be
causes: The exact cause of AN is still unclear. However, it is predominantly linked to states of insulin resistance (IR) wherein obesity, diabetes, and/or other metabolic disorders (eg, metabolic syndrome , polycystic ovary syndrome , and generalised lipodystrophy ) co-exist. Insulin in high concentrations has been shown to cross the dermal -epidermal junction, and in high concentrations to have growth-stimulating effects through its binding to type 1 insulin-like growth factor receptor (IGFR) on keratinocytes. It is this activation of IGFR that stimulates the proliferation of keratinocytes and leads to AN. Other less common presentations of AN include: Drug-related AN, which has been associated with nicotinic acid lotion , fusidic acid ointment , subcutaneous insulin, oral contraceptives, oral corticosteroids , hormones (such as diethylstilbestrol and testosterone ), triazinate, and aripiprazole Familial AN, a rare autosomal dominant condition that presents at birth or in childhood and progresses until puberty after which it either stabilizes or regresses. It is due to a mutation in the fibroblast growth factor receptor 3 (FGFR3) gene Autoimmune AN, which has been associated with systemic lupus erythematosus , Sjögren syndrome , scleroderma , and Hashimoto thyroiditis Acral acanthotic anomaly, a presentation that typically occurs in darker skin phenotypes and is limited to the elbows, knees, and dorsal aspects of the hands and feet Unilateral AN (also called naevoid acanthosis nigricans), a rare autosomal dominant genodermatosis with lesions occurring unilaterally along Blaschko lines ; it can present at any age. A recently described presentation of AN-like lesions among darker-skinned individuals, involving the forehead, cheeks, including the malar areas, and fingers was also found to be strongly associated with obesity and metabolic disorders. Malignant AN is a rare paraneoplastic syndrome likely due to the release of stimulatory growth factors by tumour cells and is typically associated with gastrointestinal malignancies, especially gastric adenocarcinoma (60%); other associated cancers include hepatobiliary carcinoma , squamous cell carcinoma , malignant melanoma , and Wilms tumour. The oral cavity is involved in 25–50% of cases. Tripe palms are a variant of malignant AN with a 90% association with internal malignancy.
symptoms: Acanthosis nigricans is characterised by symmetric, thickened, brown, velvety patches and plaques that appear most commonly in the intertriginous areas (ie, the axillae, groin, and back and sides of the neck). In women, the nipples and areolae of the breasts, the vulva , and the perineum may also be involved. The lesions of AN may become macerated and malodorous , and skin tags are an additional frequent finding. Lesions affecting the mucosal surfaces of the oral cavity, nose, larynx , and oesophagus tend to be more common and more extensive in malignant acanthosis nigricans as does the finding of pruritus. Pruritus may be present and is very common in malignant acanthosis nigricans.
epidemiology: Acanthosis nigricans affects < 1% of Caucasians. In the United States, the estimated prevalence is 13.3% among African Americans, 5.5% among Latinos, and 34.2% among Native Americans. It affects both males and females of all ages, with people < 40 years of age typically being more affected. Acanthosis nigricans was found in 18.2% of children and 19.5% of adults in a cross-sectional study (n=1730) in the United States. Those diagnosed with AN were twice as likely to have type 2 diabetes compared to those without (35.4% vs. 17.6%). Rarely, AN may present as a paraneoplastic syndrome in the setting of internal malignancy. Such malignant AN tends to develop abruptly and to occur in patients who are middle-aged and not obese.
prognosis: Cosmetic disfigurement Psychological distress Acanthosis nigricans is an independent risk factor for the presence of diabetes Complications associated with underlying disease (eg, obesity-associated complications)

causes_zh: AN 的確切病因尚不清楚。然而，它主要與肥胖、糖尿病和/或其他代謝紊亂（例如代謝綜合徵、多囊卵巢綜合徵和全身性脂肪營養不良）共存的胰島素抵抗（IR）狀態有關。高濃度的胰島素已被證明可以穿過真皮-表皮交界處，並且高濃度的胰島素通過與角質形成細胞上的 1 型胰島素樣生長因子受體 (IGFR) 結合而具有生長刺激作用。正是 IGFR 的激活刺激角質形成細胞增殖並導致 AN。其他不太常見的 AN 表現包括： 藥物相關的 AN，與菸酸洗劑、夫西地酸軟膏、皮下注射胰島素、口服避孕藥、口服皮質類固醇、激素（如己烯雌酚和睾酮）、三嗪和阿立哌唑有關。 家族性 AN，一種罕見的常染色體顯性遺傳病，在出生時或兒童期出現，並進展至青春期，之後它要么穩定，要么倒退。這是由於成纖維細胞生長因子受體 3 (FGFR3) 基因突變所致 自身免疫性 AN，與系統性紅斑狼瘡、乾燥綜合徵、硬皮病和橋本甲狀腺炎有關 肢端棘皮異常，通常發生在深色皮膚表型中，僅限於肘部、膝蓋和手足背側 單側 AN （也稱為黑棘皮病），一種罕見的常染色體顯性遺傳性皮膚病，病變沿 Blaschko 線單側發生；它可以出現在任何年齡。最近描述的深色皮膚個體中出現的 AN 樣病變，涉及前額、臉頰（包括顴骨區域）和手指，也被發現與肥胖和代謝紊亂密切相關。惡性 AN 是一種罕見的副腫瘤綜合徵，可能是由於腫瘤細胞釋放刺激性生長因子所致，通常與胃腸道惡性腫瘤相關，尤其是胃腺癌 (60%)；其他相關癌症包括肝膽癌、鱗狀細胞癌、惡性黑色素瘤和腎母細胞瘤。25-50% 的病例累及口腔。掌肚是惡性 AN 的一種變體，90% 與內部惡性腫瘤相關。
symptoms_zh: 黑棘皮症的特徵是對稱、增厚、棕色、天鵝絨般的斑塊和斑塊，最常見於間擦區域（即腋窩、腹股溝、頸背和兩側）。在女性中，乳房的乳頭和乳暈、外陰和會陰也可能受累。AN 的病變可能會變得浸漬並發出惡臭，皮贅也是一種常見的發現。影響口腔、鼻、喉和食道粘膜表面的病變在惡性黑棘皮症中更常見且更廣泛，瘙癢也是如此。惡性黑棘皮病可能會出現瘙癢，並且這種情況很常見。
epidemiology_zh: 黑棘皮病影響 < 1% 的白種人。在美國，非裔美國人的患病率估計為 13.3%，拉丁裔為 5.5%，美洲原住民為 34.2%。它影響所有年齡段的男性和女性，40 歲以下的人通常受影響更大。在美國的一項橫斷面研究 (n=1730) 中，18.2% 的兒童和 19.5% 的成人發現黑棘皮病。被診斷患有 AN 的人患 2 型糖尿病的可能性是沒有患 AN 的人的兩倍（35.4% vs. 17.6%）。極少數情況下，AN 可能在內部惡性腫瘤中表現為副腫瘤綜合徵。這種惡性AN往往發展突然，並且發生在中年且不肥胖的患者中。
prognosis_zh: 美容毀容 心理困擾 黑棘皮病是糖尿病的獨立危險因素 與基礎疾病相關的並發症（例如肥胖相關並發症）

title: Achenbach syndrome
snippet: Achenbach syndrome characteristically follows minor trauma, although this is often not recalled. Acute onset of pain followed minutes to hours later by discolouration, usually blue-purple. Palmar aspect of the dominant hand is the most common site. Second and third finger involvement is commonest, a
causes: Achenbach syndrome is a subcutaneous bruise probably due to minor fragility of capillaries or a small vein in the palmar skin. Preceding minor trauma may be recalled in 30% of cases such as sweeping, handwashing of clothing, or cycling. There is no associated serious cause for easy bruising such as a clotting disorder or vascular abnormality.
symptoms: Achenbach syndrome characteristically follows minor trauma, although this is often not recalled. Acute onset of pain followed minutes to hours later by discolouration, usually blue-purple. Palmar aspect of the dominant hand is the most common site. Second and third finger involvement is commonest, although any finger, toe, or palmar site can be affected. Sparing of the fingertip and nail bed is characteristic. Discolouration resolves spontaneously in 3–6 days (range 2–14 days), without going through the colour changes usually seen with a resolving bruise. Other — swelling; itch, burning or numbness; involvement of the dorsal digit ; limited movement. Normal findings — radial and ulnar pulses; skin perfusion ; skin temperature; nail bed capillaroscopy. Achenbach syndrome: thenar eminence Achenbach syndrome: palm Achenbach syndrome: palm
epidemiology: Achenbach syndrome has been predominantly reported in middle-aged females, with a median age of onset of 48–50 years (range 22–76). Although said to be rare, a study of 802 members of the general population aged 18 to 84 years in three regions of France found a prevalence of 12.4% in women and 1.2% of men. It is possibly more common in those with a history of Raynaud phenomenon and chilblains , however is not associated with smoking.
prognosis: None.

causes_zh: 阿亨巴赫綜合徵是一種皮下瘀傷，可能是由於手掌皮膚中的毛細血管或小靜脈輕微脆弱所致。30% 的病例可能會回憶起之前發生的輕微創傷，例如掃地、洗手衣服或騎自行車。沒有任何導致容易瘀傷的嚴重原因，例如凝血障礙或血管異常。
symptoms_zh: 阿亨巴赫綜合症的特徵是輕微創傷後發生，儘管人們常常不記得這一點。幾分鐘到幾小時後，疼痛急劇發作，顏色變色，通常為藍紫色。慣用手的掌側是最常見的部位。儘管任何手指、腳趾或手掌部位都可能受到影響，但第二和第三手指受累最為常見。其特徵是保護指尖和甲床。變色會在 3-6 天（範圍為 2-14 天）內自然消退，不會出現通常在瘀傷消退時出現的顏色變化。其他——腫脹；發癢、燒灼感或麻木；受累背指；活動受限。正常結果——橈動脈和尺動脈搏動；皮膚灌注；皮膚溫度；甲床毛細血管鏡檢查。阿亨巴赫綜合症：魚際隆起 阿亨巴赫綜合症：手掌 阿亨巴赫綜合症：手掌
epidemiology_zh: 據報導，阿亨巴赫綜合徵主要發生在中年女性，中位發病年齡為 48-50 歲（範圍 22-76 歲）。儘管據說這種情況很罕見，但一項針對法國三個地區 802 名 18 歲至 84 歲普通人群的研究發現，女性患病率為 12.4%，男性患病率為 1.2%。它在有雷諾現象和凍瘡病史的人中可能更常見，但與吸煙無關。
prognosis_zh: 沒有任何。

title: Acne
snippet: Acne is often confined to the face but it may involve the neck, chest, and back. It is characterised by: Open and closed uninflamed comedones (blackheads and whiteheads) Inflamed papules and pustules In severe acne, nodules and pseudocysts Post-inflammatory erythematous or pigmented macules and scar
causes: Acne is due to a combination of factors. The exact mechanisms are not fully understood. Familial tendency Endogenous and exogenous androgenic hormones Acne bacteria Innate immune activation with inflammatory mediators Distension and occlusion of the hair follicles Flares of acne can be provoked by: Polycystic ovarian disease Drugs: steroids , hormones, anticonvulsants , epidermal growth factor receptor inhibitors and others Application of occlusive cosmetics High environmental humidity Diet high in dairy products and high glycaemic foods.
symptoms: Acne is often confined to the face but it may involve the neck, chest, and back. It is characterised by: Open and closed uninflamed comedones (blackheads and whiteheads) Inflamed papules and pustules In severe acne, nodules and pseudocysts Post-inflammatory erythematous or pigmented macules and scars Adverse social and psychological effects . Severity is classified as mild, moderate, or severe. Mild acne: total lesion count <30 Moderate acne: total lesion count 30–125 Severe acne: total lesion count >125
epidemiology: Acne affects males and females of all races and ethnicities. It is prevalent in adolescents and young adults, with 85% of 16 to 18 year-olds affected. However, it may sometimes occur in children and adults of all ages.
snippet_zh: 痤瘡通常局限於面部，但也可能涉及頸部、胸部和背部。其特徵為： 開放性和閉合性未發炎粉刺（黑頭和白頭） 發炎丘疹和膿皰 嚴重痤瘡、結節和假性囊腫 炎症後紅斑或色素斑和疤痕
causes_zh: 痤瘡是多種因素共同作用的結果。確切的機制尚不完全清楚。家族傾向 內源性和外源性雄激素 痤瘡細菌 炎症介質的先天免疫激活 毛囊擴張和閉塞 痤瘡發作可能由以下因素引起： 多囊卵巢疾病 藥物：類固醇、激素、抗驚厥藥、表皮生長因子受體抑製劑等 使用封閉性化妝品 環境濕度高 飲食中含有大量乳製品和高血糖食物。
symptoms_zh: 痤瘡通常局限於面部，但也可能涉及頸部、胸部和背部。其特徵為： 開放性和閉合性未發炎粉刺（黑頭和白頭） 發炎丘疹和膿皰 嚴重痤瘡、結節和假性囊腫 炎症後紅斑或色素斑和疤痕 不良的社會和心理影響。嚴重程度分為輕度、中度或重度。輕度痤瘡：病變總數 <30 中度痤瘡：病變總數 30–125 重度痤瘡：病變總數 >125
epidemiology_zh: 痤瘡影響所有種族和民族的男性和女性。它在青少年和年輕人中流行，16 至 18 歲的青少年中 85% 受到影響。然而，它有時可能發生在所有年齡段的兒童和成人中。

title: Actinic keratosis
snippet: Actinic keratosis may be solitary but there are often multiple keratoses. The appearance varies. A flat or thickened papule , or plaque White or yellow; scaly, warty , or horny surface Skin coloured, red, or pigmented Tender or asymptomatic They are sometimes graded according to their appearance: Gr
causes: Actinic keratoses are the result of abnormal skin cell development due to DNA damage by short wavelength UVB. They are more likely to appear if the immune function is poor, due to ageing, recent sun exposure, predisposing disease, or certain drugs .
symptoms: Actinic keratosis may be solitary but there are often multiple keratoses. The appearance varies. A flat or thickened papule , or plaque White or yellow; scaly, warty , or horny surface Skin coloured, red, or pigmented Tender or asymptomatic They are sometimes graded according to their appearance: Grade 1: Mild pink or grey marks with slight scale and gritty to touch Grade 2: Moderate thicker hyperkeratosis and easily detected Grade 3: Severe hyperkeratotic thick keratin Grade 4: Confluent areas several centimetres with a range of the above grades of AK Actinic keratoses are very common on sites repeatedly exposed to the sun, especially the backs of the hands and the face, most often affecting the ears, nose, cheeks, upper lip, vermilion of the lower lip, temples, forehead, and balding scalp. In severely chronically sun-damaged individuals, they may also be found on the upper trunk, upper and lower limbs, and dorsum of feet. Field change over the forehead with multiple superficial actinic keratoses Thicker actinic keratoses on the dorsal hand Hyperkeratotic actinic keratoses on the forehead Many more images of actinic keratoses ... Keratoses on the nose Keratoses on the face Keratoses on the scalp Keratoses on the hands Keratoses on the legs Keratoses treated with imiquimod
epidemiology: Actinic keratoses affect people that have often lived in the tropics or subtropics and have predisposing factors such as: Other signs of photoageing skin Fair skin with a history of sunburn History of long hours spent outdoors for work or recreation Defective immune system. However, even in temperate climates they may be common - in southern Ireland and northwest England up to 25% of people aged 60 years and over have at least one.
prognosis: The main concern is that actinic keratoses indicate an increased risk of developing cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma . It is rare for a solitary actinic keratosis to evolve to squamous cell carcinoma (SCC), but the risk of SCC occurring at some stage in a patient with more than 10 actinic keratoses is thought to be about 10 to 15%. A tender, thickened, ulcerated, or enlarging actinic keratosis is suspicious of evolution to SCC. Cutaneous horn may arise from an underlying actinic keratosis or SCC. Because they are sun damaged, people with actinic keratoses are also at risk of developing actinic cheilitis , basal cell carcinoma (BCC, which is more common than SCC), melanoma, and rare forms of skin cancer such as Merkel cell carcinoma .

causes_zh: 光化性角化病是短波 UVB 損傷 DNA 導致皮膚細胞發育異常的結果。如果由於衰老、近期日曬、誘發疾病或某些藥物而導致免疫功能較差，則更有可能出現這種情況。
symptoms_zh: 光化性角化病可能是孤立的，但通常有多個角化病。外觀各異。扁平或增厚的丘疹，或斑塊 白色或黃色；鱗狀、疣狀或角質表面 膚色、紅色或色素沉著 觸痛或無症狀 有時根據外觀進行分級： 1 級：輕度粉紅色或灰色痕跡，觸摸時有輕微鱗屑和砂礫感 2 級：中度較厚的角化過度，容易檢測到 3 級：嚴重角化過度厚厚的角蛋白 4 級：融合區域數厘米，具有上述一系列 AK Actinic 等級角化病在反复暴露在陽光下的部位很常見，尤其是手背和臉部，最常影響耳朵、鼻子、臉頰、上唇、下唇紅、太陽穴、前額和禿頂頭皮。在長期嚴重曬傷的個體中，也可能在上軀幹、上肢和下肢以及足背上發現它們。額頭上有多處淺表光化性角化病 手背上較厚的光化性角化病 額頭上角化過度的光化性角化病 更多光化性角化病的圖像... 鼻子上的角化病 臉上的角化病 頭皮上的角化病 手上的角化病 腿上的角化病 用咪喹莫特治療的角化病
epidemiology_zh: 光化性角化病會影響那些經常生活在熱帶或亞熱帶地區並具有以下誘發因素的人： 皮膚光老化的其他跡象 有曬傷史的白皙皮膚 有長時間在戶外工作或娛樂的歷史 免疫系統有缺陷。然而，即使在溫帶氣候下，它們也可能很常見——在愛爾蘭南部和英格蘭西北部，高達 25% 的 60 歲及以上的人至少擁有一種。
prognosis_zh: 主要的擔憂是光化性角化病表明患皮膚鱗狀細胞癌的風險增加。孤立性光化性角化病很少發展為鱗狀細胞癌 (SCC)，但據認為，患有超過 10 個光化性角化病的患者在某個階段發生 SCC 的風險約為 10% 至 15%。觸痛、增厚、潰爛或擴大的光化性角化病可疑演變為​​鱗狀細胞癌。皮角可能由潛在的光化性角化病或鱗狀細胞癌引起。由於受到陽光傷害，患有光化性角化病的人也有患光化性唇炎、基底細胞癌（BCC，比 SCC 更常見）、黑色素瘤和罕見形式的皮膚癌（例如默克爾細胞癌）的風險。

title: Adult-onset dermatomyositis
snippet: The skin changes of dermatomyositis will often, but not always, precede the muscle weakness. A face rash is the commonest initial skin sign , typically followed by scalp symptoms then the changes on the hands.
causes: Dermatomyositis is thought to be caused by a microangiopathy affecting skin and muscle. There is a genetic predisposition to the development of dermatomyositis such as the PTPN22 gene and HLA associations identified include: Caucasian populations: HLA DRB1*0301 and DQA1*0501 Asian populations: HLA-B7 Anti-Jo-1 antibodies : HLA DRB1*0301 and DQA1*501 Anti-Mi-2 antibodies: HLA DRB1*07 and DQA*0201. Triggers and reported associations have included: Medications — see Drug-induced dermatomyositis Malignancy Viral infections — enteroviruses, parvovirus B19, influenza Silica exposure — in tradespeople. Most patients have disease-associated autoantibodies , suggesting dermatomyositis is an autoimmune condition.
symptoms: The skin changes of dermatomyositis will often, but not always, precede the muscle weakness. A face rash is the commonest initial skin sign , typically followed by scalp symptoms then the changes on the hands.
epidemiology: Dermatomyositis is uncommon, with an annual incidence of 0.1-6 per population of 100,000. It can affect people of any race, age, and sex ; however, women are affected twice as often as men, and Black Americans are more commonly affected than white Americans. It can present in children (see Juvenile dermatomyositis ). The peak age group affected in adults is those aged 50–60 years. Adult-onset dermatomyositis is strongly associated with malignancy ; up to 25% of affected adults have an unknown underlying malignancy on diagnosis. The majority are adenocarcinomas.
prognosis: When dermatomyositis affects swallowing, it may be complicated by: Weight loss Aspiration pneumonia. Other systemic features of dermatomyositis may include: Arthritis Cardiac arrhythmias Interstitial lung disease Pulmonary arterial hypertension.
snippet_zh: 皮肌炎的皮膚變化通常（但並非總是）先於肌肉無力發生。面部皮疹是最常見的初始皮膚症狀，通常隨後出現頭皮症狀，然後是手上的變化。
causes_zh: 皮肌炎被認為是由影響皮膚和肌肉的微血管病引起的。皮肌炎的發生具有遺傳傾向，例如 PTPN22 基因和 HLA 關聯，已確定包括： 高加索人群：HLA DRB1*0301 和 DQA1*0501 亞洲人群：HLA-B7 抗 Jo-1 抗體：HLA DRB1*0301 和 DQA1*501 抗 Mi-2 抗體：HLA DRB1*07 和DQA*0201。觸發因素和報告的關聯包括： 藥物 — 參見藥物誘發的皮肌炎 惡性腫瘤 病毒感染 — 腸道病毒、細小病毒 B19、流感 商人接觸二氧化矽。大多數患者俱有與疾病相關的自身抗體，表明皮肌炎是一種自身免疫性疾病。
symptoms_zh: 皮肌炎的皮膚變化通常（但並非總是）先於肌肉無力發生。面部皮疹是最常見的初始皮膚症狀，通常隨後出現頭皮症狀，然後是手上的變化。
epidemiology_zh: 皮肌炎並不常見，每 100,000 人的年發病率為 0.1-6 例。它可以影響任何種族、年齡和性別的人；然而，女性受到影響的頻率是男性的兩倍，美國黑人比美國白人更容易受到影響。它可以出現在兒童中（參見青少年皮肌炎）。成人受影響的高峰年齡組是 50-60 歲。成人發病的皮肌炎與惡性腫瘤密切相關；高達 25% 的受影響成年人在診斷時患有未知的潛在惡性腫瘤。大多數是腺癌。
prognosis_zh: 當皮肌炎影響吞嚥時，可能會並發以下情況： 體重減輕 吸入性肺炎。皮肌炎的其他全身特徵可能包括： 關節炎 心律失常 間質性肺病 肺動脈高壓。

title: Allergic contact dermatitis
snippet: Allergic contact dermatitis arises some hours after contact with the responsible material. It settles down over some days providing the skin is no longer in contact with the allergen. Allergic contact dermatitis is generally confined to the site of contact with the allergen, but it may extend outsid
causes: Allergic contact dermatitis is a type 4 or delayed hypersensitivity reaction and occurs 48–72 hours after exposure to the allergen . The mechanism involves CD4+ T- lymphocytes , which recognise an antigen on the skin surface, releasing cytokines that activate the immune system and cause the dermatitis. Note: Contact allergy occurs predominantly from an allergen on the skin rather than from internal sources or food. Only a small number of people react to the specific allergen, which is harmless to those who are not allergic to it. They may have been in contact with the allergen for years without it causing dermatitis. Contact with tiny quantities of an allergen can induce dermatitis. Patients with impaired barrier function of the skin are more prone to allergic contact dermatitis, eg patients with leg ulcers , perianal dermatitis, or chronic irritant contact dermatitis . Patients with atopic dermatitis associated with defective filaggrin (a structural protein in the stratum corneum ) have a high risk of also developing allergic contact dermatitis.
symptoms: Allergic contact dermatitis arises some hours after contact with the responsible material. It settles down over some days providing the skin is no longer in contact with the allergen. Allergic contact dermatitis is generally confined to the site of contact with the allergen, but it may extend outside the contact area or become generalised. Transmission from the fingers can lead to dermatitis on the eyelids and genitals. Dermatitis is unlikely to be due to a specific allergen if the area of skin most in contact with that allergen is unaffected. The affected skin may be red and itchy, swollen and blistered, or dry and bumpy. Some typical examples of allergic contact dermatitis include: Eczema in the skin in contact with jewellery items, due to contact allergy to nickel Reactions to fragrances in perfumes and household items Eczema under adhesive plaster, due to contact allergy to rosin Swelling and blistering of face and neck in reaction to permanent hair dye, due to allergy to paraphenylenediamine Hand dermatitis caused by rubber accelerator chemicals used in the manufacture of rubber gloves Itchy red face due to contact with methylisothiazolinone , a preservative in wash-off hair products and baby wipes Fingertip dermatitis due to acrylates used in hair extensions and nail cosmetics. Reactions after dental implants containing acrylates Localised blistering at the site of topical medications such as antibiotics Swelling and blistering on exposed sites (eg face and hands) due to contact with plants such as poison ivy or, in New Zealand, the Japanese wax tree Toxicodendron succedaneum . There is a very long list of materials that have caused contact allergy in a small number of individuals. Adhesive plaster reaction Sunscreen reaction Watch strap reaction Allergic contact dermatitis due to an adhesive in orthopaedic strapping See more images of allergic contact dermatitis Specific allergic contact dermatitis images. Facial dermatitis images Hand dermatitis images Limb dermatitis images Truncal dermatitis images Patch test results images
epidemiology: Allergic contact dermatitis is common in the general population and in specific employment groups. It is more common in women than men, mainly due to nickel allergy and, recently, to acrylate allergy associated with nail cosmetics . Many young children are also allergic to nickel. Contact allergy to topical antibiotics is common in patients over the age of 70 years old. Allergic contact dermatitis is especially common in metal workers, hairdressers , beauticians , health care workers , cleaners , painters , and florists .
prognosis: Allergic contact dermatitis starts as a localised reaction to an allergen in contact with the skin, but severe reactions may generalise due to autoeczematisation and can lead to erythroderma . Ingestion of a contact allergen may rarely lead to baboon syndrome or generalised systemic contact dermatitis .
snippet_zh: 接觸致敏材料數小時後會出現過敏性接觸性皮炎。只要皮膚不再與過敏原接觸，幾天后它就會穩定下來。過敏性接觸性皮炎通常局限於與過敏原接觸的部位，但也可能擴展到外部
causes_zh: 過敏性接觸性皮炎是一種 4 型或遲髮型過敏反應，發生在接觸過敏原後 48-72 小時。其機制涉及 CD4+ T 淋巴細胞，它們識別皮膚表面的抗原，釋放細胞因子，激活免疫系統並引起皮炎。注意：接觸過敏主要由皮膚上的過敏原而不是內部來源或食物引起。只有少數人會對特定的過敏原產生反應，這對於不過敏的人來說是無害的。他們可能已經接觸過敏原多年而沒有引起皮炎。接觸微量過敏原會誘發皮炎。皮膚屏障功能受損的患者更容易發生過敏性接觸性皮炎，例如腿部潰瘍、肛周皮炎或慢性刺激性接觸性皮炎的患者。患有與絲聚蛋白（角質層中的一種結構蛋白）缺陷相關的特應性皮炎的患者也有很高的風險患上過敏性接觸性皮炎。
symptoms_zh: 接觸致敏材料數小時後會出現過敏性接觸性皮炎。只要皮膚不再與過敏原接觸，幾天后它就會穩定下來。過敏性接觸性皮炎通常局限於與過敏原接觸的部位，但也可能擴展到接觸區域之外或變得全身性。從手指傳播可導致眼瞼和生殖器皮炎。如果與特定過敏原最常接觸的皮膚區域不受影響，則皮炎不太可能是由特定過敏原引起的。受影響的皮膚可能會發紅、發癢、腫脹、起水泡，或者乾燥、凹凸不平。過敏性接觸性皮炎的一些典型例子包括： 由於對鎳過敏而導致與珠寶物品接觸的皮膚出現濕疹 對香水和家居用品中的香料產生反應 由於對鬆香過敏而在橡皮膏下出現濕疹 由於對對苯二胺過敏而導致面部和頸部因永久性染髮劑而出現腫脹和起泡 製造橡膠手套時使用的橡膠促進劑化學品引起的手部皮炎 由於接觸橡膠手套而導致面部發紅發癢甲基異噻唑啉酮，一種洗掉型護髮產品和嬰兒濕巾中的防腐劑 由於接發和指甲化妝品中使用的丙烯酸酯而導致指尖皮炎。含有丙烯酸酯的牙種植體後的反應 抗生素等局部用藥部位局部起泡 由於接觸毒藤等植物或新西蘭的日本蠟樹 Toxicodendron succedaneum ，導致暴露部位（例如面部和手部）腫脹和起泡。引起少數人接觸過敏的材料有很長的清單。膠布反應 防曬霜反應 錶帶反應 矯形帶中的粘合劑導致過敏性接觸性皮炎 查看更多過敏性接觸性皮炎圖片 特定的過敏性接觸性皮炎圖片。面部皮炎圖像 手部皮炎圖像 四肢皮炎圖像 軀乾皮炎圖像 斑貼試驗結果圖像
epidemiology_zh: 過敏性接觸性皮炎在普通人群和特定就業群體中很常見。女性比男性更常見，主要是由於鎳過敏，以及最近與指甲化妝品相關的丙烯酸酯過敏。許多幼兒也對鎳過敏。對外用抗生素的接觸性過敏在 70 歲以上的患者中很常見。過敏性接觸性皮炎在金屬工人、美髮師、美容師、保健人員、清潔工、油漆工和花匠中尤其常見。
prognosis_zh: 過敏性接觸性皮炎始於對與皮膚接觸的過敏原的局部反應，但嚴重的反應可能由於自身濕疹而普遍化，並可能導致紅皮病。攝入接觸性過敏原很少會導致狒狒綜合症或全身性接觸性皮炎。

title: Alopecia areata
snippet: Acute onset of hair loss may manifest in a number of patterns. Patchy alopecia areata is the most common pattern, producing: Focal hair loss Well- demarcated single or several round/oval patches of normal-appearing skin. The scalp is most commonly affected, but may also affect the: Beard Eyebrows Ey
causes: A normal hair follicle cycles through multiple phases: Anagen is the active growth phase lasting one to eight years Catagen is a short involution phase lasting several weeks Telogen is the resting phase lasting several months Exogen is the shedding of the hair. The exact mechanism responsible for hair loss in alopecia areata remains unclear. It is hypothesised that loss of immune privilege in anagen hair follicles plays a key role in the pathogenesis , and genetic susceptibility is also thought to contribute. Immune privilege hypothesis Normal anagen hair follicles are thought to exhibit immune privilege, rendering them exempt from immune surveillance and protected against autoimmune attack. Protective immune privilege may be lost in alopecia areata, allowing hair follicle autoantigens to be presented to autoreactive CD8+ T cells. Subsequent autoimmune attack of the anagen follicle causes premature transition of the follicle into the telogen phase with ultimate loss of the hair. This hypothesis is supported by the observation of a dense perifollicular infiltrate of T cells on histopathological examination of anagen follicles in alopecia areata; an area that is normally sparse of immune cells. Genetic factors Alopecia areata has a strong hereditary component. At least 16 genetic risk loci have been detected. Include numerous human leukocyte antigen ( HLA ) class I and II alleles , and several alleles of genes involved in immune pathways, hair pigmentation , and response to oxidative stress. Mode of inheritance appears to be complex, with environmental influences also at play.
symptoms: Acute onset of hair loss may manifest in a number of patterns. Patchy alopecia areata is the most common pattern, producing: Focal hair loss Well- demarcated single or several round/oval patches of normal-appearing skin. The scalp is most commonly affected, but may also affect the: Beard Eyebrows Eyelashes Any other hair-bearing areas. Less common patterns include: Alopecia totalis – complete loss of scalp hair Affects up to 5% of patients with autoimmune hair loss Alopecia universalis – complete loss of body hair Affects less than 1% Ophiasis — bandlike hair loss on the occipital and temporal scalp margins Sisaipho (ophiasis inversus) — hair loss on the frontal, temporal, and parietal scalp which may mimic male pattern hair loss Diffuse alopecia areata (alopecia areata incognita) — rapid and widespread hair loss. Sudden greying — loss of pigmented hairs, resulting in the unmasking of existing grey hairs (“white overnight”). Other features Characteristic “exclamation point hairs” may be observed, particularly at the periphery of bald patches. An exclamation point hair is a broken strand with a relatively thick distal portion and thin proximal portion as it enters the scalp. They are the result of anagen arrest and cessation of hair shaft formation, with weakening and tapering of the shaft. Some patients may experience localised tingling or itching preceding hair loss ( trichodynia ). Upon regrowth, hairs may initially lack pigment and so grow back as white or blonde. Nail changes can be seen in an estimated 10–40% of patients and tend to be associated with more severe disease. Nail pitting and ridging are most common. Other nail features include koilonychia , trachyonychia , Beau’s lines, onychorrhexis , onychomadesis , onycholysis , and red spots in the lunula. Click here for images
epidemiology: The lifetime risk of alopecia areata is approximately 2%. It affects children and adults of all skin and hair colours. Peak incidence occurs in the second and third decades and most patients experience onset before the fourth decade. Alopecia areata does not carry significant sex or ethnic predominance. The following may increase the risk of alopecia areata: Chromosomal disorders such as Down syndrome Polyglandular autoimmune syndrome type 1 Other autoimmune conditions such as vitiligo and thyroid disease A family history of alopecia areata Certain susceptibility genes (see below).
prognosis: Poor health-related quality of life due to distress. Higher rates of depression and generalised anxiety disorder; adjustment disorders are also common. Other autoimmune conditions may be more commonly observed in patients with alopecia areata e.g. thyroid disease , vitiligo , psoriasis , diabetes mellitus , and atopy.
snippet_zh: 急性脫髮可能有多種表現形式。斑片狀斑禿是最常見的模式，會產生： 局灶性脫髮 正常皮膚上界限分明的單個或幾個圓形/橢圓形斑塊。頭皮最常受到影響，但也可能影響： 鬍鬚 眉毛 眼睛
causes_zh: 正常的毛囊會經歷多個階段的循環： 生長期是持續一到八年的活躍生長期 退行期是持續數週的短暫退化階段 休止期是持續數月的休止期 外生期是頭髮的脫落。導致斑禿脫髮的確切機制仍不清楚。據推測，生長期毛囊免疫特權的喪失在發病機制中起關鍵作用，並且遺傳易感性也被認為是其中的一個因素。免疫特權假說 正常的生長期毛囊被認為表現出免疫特權，使它們免受免疫監視並免受自身免疫攻擊。斑禿可能會喪失保護性免疫特權，從而使毛囊自身抗原呈遞給自身反應性 CD8+ T 細胞。隨後對毛髮生長初期毛囊的自身免疫攻擊導致毛囊過早過渡到毛髮生長終期，最終導致毛髮脫落。在斑禿毛囊的組織病理學檢查中觀察到毛囊周圍有密集的 T 細胞浸潤，支持了這一假設；通常免疫細胞稀疏的區域。遺傳因素 斑禿有很強的遺傳成分。至少檢測到16個遺傳風險位點。包括大量人類白細胞抗原 (HLA) I 類和 II 類等位基因，以及涉及免疫途徑、毛髮色素沉著和氧化應激反應的多個基因等位基因。遺傳模式似乎很複雜，環境影響也發揮著作用。
symptoms_zh: 急性脫髮可能有多種表現形式。斑片狀斑禿是最常見的模式，會產生： 局灶性脫髮 正常皮膚上界限分明的單個或幾個圓形/橢圓形斑塊。頭皮最常受到影響，但也可能影響： 鬍鬚 眉毛 睫毛 任何其他有毛髮的區域。不太常見的模式包括： 全禿 - 頭皮毛髮完全脫落 影響高達 5% 的自身免疫性脫髮患者 普禿 - 體毛完全脫落 影響不到 1% 蛇形脫髮 - 枕骨和顳部頭皮邊緣帶狀脫髮 西塞福（逆蛇形） - 額葉、顳部和頂葉頭皮脫髮，可能類似於男性型脫髮 瀰漫性斑禿（ alopecia areata incognita ）——快速且廣泛的脫髮。突然變白——色素毛髮脫落，導致現有的白髮顯露出來（“一夜變白”）。其他特徵 可能會觀察到特徵性的“感嘆號毛髮”，特別是在禿斑的周圍。感嘆號頭髮是一根斷裂的髮絲，當它進入頭皮時，遠端部分相對較粗，近端部分較細。它們是毛髮生長初期停滯和毛幹形成停止的結果，伴隨著毛幹的減弱和逐漸變細。一些患者在脫髮之前可能會出現局部刺痛或瘙癢（毛髮痛）。再生後，毛髮最初可能缺乏色素，因此會長回白色或金色。估計有 10-40% 的患者會出現指甲變化，並且往往與更嚴重的疾病有關。指甲凹陷和起皺是最常見的。其他指甲特徵包括反甲、粗甲、博氏紋、甲裂、脫甲、甲松解和月牙紅斑。單擊此處查看圖像
epidemiology_zh: 斑禿的終生風險約為 2%。它影響所有膚色和頭髮顏色的兒童和成人。發病高峰出現在第二個和第三個十年，大多數患者在第四個十年之前發病。斑禿不具有顯著的性別或種族優勢。以下情況可能會增加斑禿的風險： 染色體疾病，如唐氏綜合症 多腺體自身免疫綜合症 1 型 其他自身免疫性疾病，如白癜風和甲狀腺疾病 斑禿家族史 某些易感基因（見下文）。
prognosis_zh: 由於痛苦而導致健康相關的生活質量差。抑鬱症和廣泛性焦慮症的發病率較高；適應障礙也很常見。其他自身免疫性疾病在斑禿患者中可能更常見，例如脫髮。甲狀腺疾病、白癜風、牛皮癬、糖尿病和特應性。

title: Angular cheilitis
snippet: Angular cheilitis may result in the following symptoms and signs at the corners of the mouth: Painful cracks/ fissures worse on mouth opening Blisters, erosions , oozing, crusting Redness (or pallor /darkening of the skin in some cases) Bleeding. It is usually bilateral and symmetrical , however, it
causes: Angular cheilitis occurs at the angles of the mouth where two different types of skin lining meet and act as a hinge. The lining of the oral cavity (oral mucosa ) meets with squamous epithelium (facial skin). As they are used often for eating, drinking, and talking, they are vulnerable to stress/ trauma. Angular cheilitis most commonly occurs due to prolonged exposure of the corners of the mouth to saliva and its digestive enzymes , resulting in eczematous cheilitis (a form of irritant contact dermatitis )
symptoms: Angular cheilitis may result in the following symptoms and signs at the corners of the mouth: Painful cracks/ fissures worse on mouth opening Blisters, erosions , oozing, crusting Redness (or pallor /darkening of the skin in some cases) Bleeding. It is usually bilateral and symmetrical , however, it can occur on one side. It may progress to more widespread impetigo or candidiasis (oral thrush) on the adjacent skin and elsewhere. Click here for images
epidemiology: Angular cheilitis is common and can affect any child or adult. Those with poor health are especially susceptible. Risk factors include: Dry chapped lips of any cause Oral thrush — this is more likely to occur in infancy, old age, diabetics, concurrent corticosteroid use or antibiotic use, and immunocompromised patients Dentures (especially if ill-fitted and there is associated gum recession) Poor nutrition — coeliac disease, iron deficiency , riboflavin deficiency, general protein deficiency, zinc deficiency, vitamin B12 and/or folate deficiency Systemic illness, particularly inflammatory bowel disease (ulcerative colitis and Crohn disease) and Sjogren syndrome Sensitive skin, especially atopic dermatitis Genetic predisposition — eg, in Down syndrome Oral retinoid medication — can cause dry lips, eg, isotretinoin , acitretin Rapid weight loss — leads to reduced skin turgor/elasticity and increased skin folds Smoking — reduces skin turgor/elasticity Retrognathia (abnormal posterior /set-back position of the jaw) An overhang of the upper lip resulting in deep furrows (marionette lines). It is made worse by licking the lips .
prognosis: Rarely, if chronic or left untreated, angular cheilitis can cause permanent scarring and discolouration of the skin. If the cause is a bacterial infection , there is a risk of the infection spreading to nearby skin. Risk of subsequent infection such as fungal infection, oral thrush .

causes_zh: 口角炎發生在嘴角，兩種不同類型的皮膚襯里相遇並充當鉸鏈。口腔內壁（口腔粘膜）與鱗狀上皮（面部皮膚）相遇。由於它們經常用於吃飯、喝水和說話，因此很容易受到壓力/創傷。口角炎最常見的原因是嘴角長時間暴露於唾液及其消化酶，導致濕疹性唇炎（刺激性接觸性皮炎的一種形式） 。
symptoms_zh: 口角炎可能會導致嘴角出現以下症狀和體徵： 疼痛性裂紋/裂口，張口時加重 水泡、糜爛、滲血、結痂 發紅（或在某些情況下皮膚蒼白/變黑） 出血。它通常是雙側且對稱的，但也可能發生在一側。它可能會在鄰近皮膚和其他地方發展為更廣泛的膿皰病或念珠菌病（鵝口瘡）。單擊此處查看圖像
epidemiology_zh: 口角炎很常見，可以影響任何兒童或成人。健康狀況不佳的人尤其容易受到影響。危險因素包括： 任何原因造成的嘴唇乾燥乾裂 鵝口瘡 — 這種情況更容易發生在嬰儿期、老年、糖尿病患者、同時使用皮質類固醇或抗生素以及免疫功能低下的患者 假牙（尤其是不合適且伴有牙齦萎縮的情況下） 營養不良 — 乳糜瀉、缺鐵、核黃素缺乏、一般性蛋白質缺乏、鋅缺乏、維生素 B12 和/或葉酸缺乏 全身性疾病，特別是炎症性腸病（潰瘍性結腸炎）皮膚敏感，尤其是特應性皮炎 遺傳傾向 - 例如唐氏綜合症 口服維A酸類藥物 - 可導致嘴唇乾燥，例如異維A酸、阿維A 體重快速減輕 - 導致皮膚彈性/彈性降低和皮膚褶皺增加 吸煙 - 降低皮膚彈性/彈性 下頜後縮（下頜位置異常後縮） 上唇突出導致深皺紋（木偶紋）。舔嘴唇會使情況變得更糟。
prognosis_zh: 在極少數情況下，如果慢性或不及時治療，口角炎會導致永久性疤痕和皮膚變色。如果原因是細菌感染，則存在感染擴散到附近皮膚的風險。後續感染的風險，例如真菌感染、鵝口瘡。

title: Aphthous ulcer
snippet: An aphthous ulcer is typically a solitary round or oval punched-out sore or ulcer inside the mouth on an area where the mucosa is not tightly bound to the underlying bone, such as on the inside of the lips and cheeks or underneath the tongue. Aphthous ulcers can also affect the genitalia in males an
causes: The exact reason why aphthous ulcer develops is not yet clearly defined. Approximately 40% of people who get aphthous ulcers have a family history of aphthous ulcers. Current thinking is that the immune system is disturbed by some external factor and reacts abnormally against a protein in mucosal tissue. Factors that seem to trigger outbreaks of ulcers include: Emotional stress and lack of sleep Mechanical trauma , for example, self-inflicted bite Nutritional deficiency, particularly of vitamin B, iron, and folic acid Certain foods, including chocolate Certain toothpastes; this may relate to sodium laureth sulphate (the foaming component of toothpaste) Menstruation Certain medications, including nicorandil, given for angina Viral infections.
symptoms: An aphthous ulcer is typically a solitary round or oval punched-out sore or ulcer inside the mouth on an area where the mucosa is not tightly bound to the underlying bone, such as on the inside of the lips and cheeks or underneath the tongue. Aphthous ulcers can also affect the genitalia in males and females. Recurrent aphthous ulcer usually begins as a round yellowish elevated spot surrounded by a red halo. This then breaks down into a punched-out ulcer, which is covered with a loosely attached white, yellow, or greyish membrane. Surrounding tissue is healthy and unaffected. The ulcer can be painful, particularly if irritated by movement or eating certain types of food such as citrus fruit. People may experience a single ulcer or multiple ulcers. Multiple ulcers tend to be widely distributed throughout a person's mouth. Aphthous ulceration is classified into three types. Recurrent minor aphthous ulcer (80%). This is less than 5 mm in diameter and heals within 1–2 weeks. Major aphthous ulcer, which is large (often more than 10 mm) and takes weeks or months to heal and leaves a scar. Herpetiform ulcers, which are multiple pinpoint ulcers that heal within a month. These are most commonly on the tongue.
epidemiology: Anyone can get an aphthous ulcer; 20% of the population have one or more, at least occasionally. They usually first appear in childhood or adolescence, and more commonly affect females than males. Aphthous ulcers can be an early manifestation of a systemic disease such as Behçet disease, or gastrointestinal disorders including coeliac disease, Crohn disease , and ulcerative colitis . Aphthous stomatitis is a feature of the recurrent fever syndrome PFAPA syndrome . Interestingly, smoking may be protective against aphthae, even though smoking makes many oral and skin conditions worse.
prognosis: Most recurrent minor aphthous ulcers heal within 1–2 weeks without scarring without any treatment. Minor aphthous ulcers commonly recur intermittently. Recurrent aphthous ulcers are mostly a minor nuisance, but they are associated with significant health problems in some people. Major aphthous ulcer heals with scarring.
snippet_zh: 口瘡性潰瘍通常是口腔內粘膜與下方骨骼未緊密結合的區域（例如嘴唇和臉頰內側或舌頭下方）的孤立的圓形或橢圓形沖孔瘡或潰瘍。口瘡性潰瘍也會影響男性的生殖器
causes_zh: 口瘡性潰瘍發生的確切原因尚未明確。大約 40% 的口瘡性潰瘍患者有口瘡性潰瘍家族史。目前的想法是，免疫系統受到某些外部因素的干擾，並對粘膜組織中的蛋白質做出異常反應。引發潰瘍爆發的因素包括： 情緒壓力和睡眠不足 機械性創傷，例如自殘咬傷 營養缺乏，尤其是維生素 B、鐵和葉酸 某些食物，包括巧克力 某些牙膏；這可能與月桂醇聚醚硫酸鈉（牙膏的泡沫成分）有關。月經 某些用於治療心絞痛的藥物，包括尼可地爾 病毒感染。
symptoms_zh: 口瘡性潰瘍通常是口腔內粘膜與下方骨骼未緊密結合的區域（例如嘴唇和臉頰內側或舌頭下方）的孤立的圓形或橢圓形沖孔瘡或潰瘍。口瘡性潰瘍也會影響男性和女性的生殖器。復發性阿弗他潰瘍通常開始時是一個圓形的淡黃色隆起斑點，周圍有紅色暈圈。然後它會分解成穿孔性潰瘍，上面覆蓋著一層鬆散的白色、黃色或灰色的薄膜。周圍組織健康且未受影響。潰瘍可能會很痛，特別是當運動或吃某些類型的食物（如柑橘類水果）刺激時。人們可能會經歷單個潰瘍或多個潰瘍。多個潰瘍往往廣泛分佈在一個人的整個口腔中。口瘡性潰瘍分為三種類型。復發性輕微阿弗他潰瘍（80%）。直徑小於 5 毫米，1-2 週內癒合。嚴重口瘡性潰瘍，面積較大（通常超過 10 毫米），需要數週或數月才能癒合並留下疤痕。皰疹樣潰瘍是多發性針尖潰瘍，一個月內即可癒合。這些最常見於舌頭上。
epidemiology_zh: 任何人都可能患上口瘡性潰瘍； 20% 的人口至少偶爾有一種或多種。它們通常首先出現在兒童期或青春期，並且女性比男性更常見。口瘡性潰瘍可能是全身性疾病（例如白塞病）或胃腸道疾病（包括乳糜瀉、克羅恩病和潰瘍性結腸炎）的早期表現。口瘡性口炎的一個特點是反復發熱綜合徵 PFAPA 綜合徵。有趣的是，吸煙可能可以預防口瘡，儘管吸煙會使許多口腔和皮膚狀況惡化。
prognosis_zh: 大多數復發性輕微阿弗他潰瘍無需任何治療即可在 1-2 週內痊癒，不留疤痕。輕微的口瘡潰瘍通常會間歇性複發。復發性口瘡潰瘍大多是一個小麻煩，但它們與某些人的嚴重健康問題有關。嚴重的口瘡性潰瘍癒合後會留下疤痕。

title: Athlete's foot
snippet: The clinical features of athlete's foot may include: Moist, peeling skin between the toes White, yellow, or greenish discolouration Sometimes, thickened skin Painful fissures Unpleasant smell. Athlet's foot is generally mild; very inflamed athlete's foot is generally due to secondary bacterial infec
causes: Athlete's foot is generally due to proliferation of dermatophyte fungi of the genera Trichophyton rubrum , Trichophyton interdigitale , and Epidermophyton floccosum .
symptoms: The clinical features of athlete's foot may include: Moist, peeling skin between the toes White, yellow, or greenish discolouration Sometimes, thickened skin Painful fissures Unpleasant smell. Athlet's foot is generally mild; very inflamed athlete's foot is generally due to secondary bacterial infection .

causes_zh: 腳氣通常是由於紅色毛癬菌、指間毛癬菌和絮狀表皮癬菌屬的皮膚癬菌的增殖所致。
symptoms_zh: 腳氣的臨床特徵可能包括： 腳趾間皮膚潮濕、脫皮 白色、黃色或綠色變色 有時，皮膚增厚 裂痕疼痛 難聞的氣味。腳氣一般較輕；腳氣發炎很嚴重一般是由於繼發細菌感染所致。

title: Atopic dermatitis
snippet: The clinical phenotype of atopic dermatitis can vary greatly, but is characterised by remission and relapse with acute flares on a background of chronic dermatitis. Acute dermatitis is red ( erythematous ), weeping/ crusted (exudative) and may have blisters ( vesicles or bullae ). Over time the derm
causes: Atopic dermatitis results from a complex interplay between environmental and genetic factors [see Causes of atopic dermatitis ].
symptoms: The clinical phenotype of atopic dermatitis can vary greatly, but is characterised by remission and relapse with acute flares on a background of chronic dermatitis. Acute dermatitis is red ( erythematous ), weeping/ crusted (exudative) and may have blisters ( vesicles or bullae ). Over time the dermatitis becomes chronic and the skin becomes less red but thickened (lichenified) and scaly. Cracking of the skin ( fissures ) can occur.
epidemiology: Approximately 230 million people around the world have atopic dermatitis and the lifetime prevalence is >15% especially in wealthier countries. It typically affects people with an ‘atopic tendency’ clustering with hay fever , asthma, and food allergies. All races can be affected; some races are more susceptible to developing atopic dermatitis, and genetic studies are showing marked diversity of the condition’s extent (heterogeneity) between populations. Atopic dermatitis usually starts in infancy, affecting up to 20% of children. Approximately 80% of children affected develop it before the age of 6 years. All ages can be affected. Although it can settle in late childhood and adolescence, the prevalence in young adults up to 26 years of age is still 5–15%. Infantile atopic dermatitis on the cheeks Flexural atopic dermatitis in childhood Excoriated lichenified atopic dermatitis on the lower back in an adult
prognosis: Complications of atopic dermatitis are covered in detail on other DermNet webpages. Complications of atopic dermatitis Psychological effects of atopic dermatitis Contact dermatitis , Occupational skin disease Staphylococcal skin infection Eczema herpeticum , Eczema coxsackium , Molluscum contagiosum Erythroderma

causes_zh: 特應性皮炎是由環境和遺傳因素之間複雜的相互作用引起的[參見特應性皮炎的原因]。
symptoms_zh: 特應性皮炎的臨床表型差異很大，但其特點是緩解和復發，並在慢性皮炎的基礎上出現急性發作。急性皮炎呈紅色（紅斑）、滲出/結痂（滲出），並可能有水皰（水皰或大皰）。隨著時間的推移，皮炎變成慢性，皮膚變得不那麼紅，但增厚（苔蘚化）和鱗片。可能會發生皮膚破裂（裂縫）。
epidemiology_zh: 全球約有 2.3 億人患有特應性皮炎，終生患病率 >15%，尤其是在富裕國家。它通常會影響具有“特應性傾向”的人，包括花粉熱、哮喘和食物過敏。所有種族都會受到影響；一些種族更容易患特應性皮炎，遺傳研究表明，不同人群之間的病情程度（異質性）存在顯著差異。特應性皮炎通常始於嬰儿期，影響高達 20% 的兒童。大約 80% 受影響的兒童在 6 歲之前發病。所有年齡段的人都可能受到影響。雖然它可以在兒童晚期和青春期穩定下來，但在 26 歲以下的年輕人中患病率仍然為 5-15%。臉頰上的嬰兒特應性皮炎 兒童時期的彎曲特應性皮炎 成人下背部的擦傷性苔蘚化特應性皮炎

Salmonella species (eg, Salmonella typhi) Typhoid fever Aeromonas species (found in water) (Rarely) cause skin and soft tissue infections Tick-borne bacterial infections Borrelia burgdorferi ( Lyme disease ) Babesia microti ( relapsing fever ) Francisella tularensis ( tularaemia ) Rickettsial diseases (some also transmitted by body lice , fleas , mosquitoes, and mites ) Ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis Other conditions sometimes caused by or associated with bacterial infection include: Kawasaki disease (mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome) Folliculitis barbae (shaving bumps) Sarcoidosis Scalp folliculitis Osler nodes and Janeway lesions (bacterial endocarditis ) Vaginitis and bacterial vaginosis .
symptoms: Bacterial skin infections can result in diverse clinical presentations. Generally, they will present with erythema, pain, warmth, swelling, and, depending on severity, dysfunction. Purulent discharge and lymphadenopathy may also be evident on examination. In severe infections, the following signs may be present: Temperature instability (higher than 38⁰C or lower than 35⁰C) Tachycardia Altered mental status Rapid progression of infection Haemorrhagic or violaceous bullae Signs of necrosis Crepitus.
epidemiology: Bacterial skin infections are a common reason for emergency visits. Children under five years and adults over 65 years old are affected more often than other age groups. In 2005, the World Health Organisation (WHO) reported a high prevalence of skin disease in children from developing countries in sub-Saharan Africa. Gender may also play a role; in one North American study, men comprised 60-70% of all cases of cellulitis. Certain comorbid conditions increase susceptibility to bacterial skin infections, such as diabetes , vascular insufficiency, and being immunocompromised (eg, chemotherapy patients with neutropaenia). Some people, such as those who inject drugs , are at increased risk. Among hospitalised patients, skin infections are prevalent and often complicate the hospital course.
prognosis: Skin breakdown Abscess formation Sepsis (can be life-threatening) Septic emboli Scarring or postinflammatory hyperpigmentation Rheumatic fever (may result from Streptococcal skin infection ) Recurrent infection Infections due to resistant bacteria (eg, methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus /MRSA ) may be more difficult to treat.

symptoms_zh: 細菌性皮膚感染可導致不同的臨床表現。一般來說，它們會出現紅斑、疼痛、發熱、腫脹，根據嚴重程度，還會出現功能障礙。檢查時也可能出現明顯的膿性分泌物和淋巴結腫大。嚴重感染時，可能會出現以下症狀： 體溫不穩定（高於 38⁰C 或低於 35⁰C） 心動過速 精神狀態改變 感染快速進展 出血性或紫色大皰 壞死跡象 捻發音。
epidemiology_zh: 細菌性皮膚感染是緊急就診的常見原因。五歲以下兒童和 65 歲以上成人比其他年齡組更容易受到影響。2005年，世界衛生組織（WHO）報告稱，撒哈拉以南非洲發展中國家的兒童皮膚病患病率很高。性別也可能發揮作用；在北美的一項研究中，男性佔所有蜂窩織炎病例的 60-70%。某些合併症會增加對細菌性皮膚感染的易感性，例如糖尿病、血管功能不全和免疫功能低下（例如伴有中性粒細胞減少症的化療患者）。有些人，例如注射吸毒者，面臨更高的風險。在住院患者中，皮膚感染很普遍，並且常常使住院過程變得複雜。
prognosis_zh: 皮膚破裂 膿腫形成 敗血症（可能危及生命） 敗血性栓子 疤痕或炎症後色素沉著過度 風濕熱（可能由皮膚鏈球菌感染引起） 反复感染 耐藥細菌（例如耐甲氧西林金黃色葡萄球菌/MRSA）引起的感染可能更難治療。

causes: Balanitis can be best categorised as infectious versus non-infectious aetiologies. Infectious aetiologies include, but are not limited to: Fungal infection (most common overall cause) Candida Dermatophytosis Bacterial infection (second most common overall cause) Haemolytic streptococci Staphylococci epidermidis/aureus Viral infection Herpes simplex virus (HSV) Varicella zoster virus (VZV) Human papillomavirus (HPV) Monkeypox Protozoal Trichomonas vaginalis Parasitic Sarcoptes scabiei var. hominis (scabies) Pediculosis (lice) . Non-infectious aetiologies include, but are not limited to: Inflammatory conditions Circinate balanitis ( reactive arthritis ) Genital lichen planus Zoon’s balanitis Psoriasis Lichen sclerosus (balanitis xerotica obliterans, BXO) Pseudoepitheliomatous, keratotic and micaceous balanitis Premalignant conditions Erythroplasia of Queyrat Bowenoid papulosis Bowen’s disease Malignant conditions Squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) Miscellaneous Trauma Poor genital hygiene Fixed drug eruption Chemotherapy -induced e.g. fluorouracil (5FU) Contact dermatitis ( irritant and allergic ).
symptoms: Clinical features of balanitis vary depending on the specific aetiology. In general, clinical features include, but are not limited to: Penile soreness Dysuria Itchiness, bleeding, and erythema of the glans penis. Specific clinical features can be characterised by the following examples. Candida balanitis — blotchy erythema with small red “satellite” papules or dry dull red areas. Anaerobic infection — foul-smelling and malodorous inflammation with or without discharge ; may be accompanied by tender inguinal lymph nodes. Aerobic infection — may see uniform erythema and local oedema. Trichomonas vaginalis — superficial erosions may lead to phimosis (retraction of penile foreskin in uncircumcised persons). HSV — grouped vesicles on an erythematous base which may rupture, unveiling painful shallow, grey ulcers. HPV — multiple flesh-coloured and/or erythematous circinate lesions that become acetowhite after 5% acetic acid is applied. Circinate balanitis — grey-white annular papules that coalesce to form “geographic” areas surrounded by a white-erythematous margin on the glans penis. Often accompanied by other features of reactive arthritis (such as conjunctivitis and arthritis). Zoon’s balanitis — symmetric “cayenne pepper spots” and orange-glazed erythema on the glans penis due to microvascular haemorrhage and hemosiderin deposition. Genital lichen planus — violaceous annular papules and patches over the glans penis and scrotum; sometimes accompanied by linear white “Wickham striae” with hyperpigmented centres. BXO — otherwise known as penile lichen sclerosus; hyperkeratosis of the squamous mucosa and peri-meatal glans appearing as white confluent papules or ivory-white papular lesions. Pseudoepitheliomatous hyperkeratotic and micaceous balanitis — thick well circumscribed mica like scaling over the glans Drug-induced balanitis — clearly demarcated erythema, oedema, and/or blistering of the glans penis; may be violaceous; history of provocative drug use before onset. Click here for images of Balanitis
epidemiology: Balanitis is present in up to 6% of young men and has an approximate overall prevalence of 3-11%. Uncircumcised men are at greater risk (approximately 68% increased lifetime incidence ) as microorganisms , epithelial debris, and secretions may accumulate between the glans penis and overlying prepuce. Difficult to distinguish inflammation of the glans penis versus prepuce involvement in uncircumcised men; therefore more frequently diagnosed with balanoposthitis. Other risk factors include: Morbid obesity Condom catheter use Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus Poverty Poor hygiene Certain drugs e.g. trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole Autoinflammatory conditions e.g. genital lichen planus and psoriasis .
prognosis: Pain and ulceration. Inflammation extension to involve the prepuce (balanoposthitis). Adhesions between the glans and prepuce. Phimosis — constriction of the opening of the prepuce that prevents retraction beyond the glans penis. Due to chronic prepuce inflammation and oedema. Can result in difficulty urinating and sexual dysfunction. Forcible retraction can lead to paraphimosis; a urologic emergency. Paraphimosis — trapping of the foreskin proximal to the glans penis limiting blood flow. Increased size and pain over minutes to hours once trapping has occurred; it is a urologic emergency requiring release of the constriction (by a dorsal slit operation). Recurrent genital infections (such as yeast) is uncommon in healthy individuals and may warrant screening for immunocompromised conditions ( HIV , diabetes, cancer ).
