causes_zh: 顆粒狀角化不全被認為是由摩擦、閉塞和出汗引起的。絲聚蛋白產生缺陷可能導致顆粒狀角化不全。這種蛋白質通常存在於上表皮中，但有多種遺傳變異會導致皮膚屏障功能減弱。其中包括皮膚乾燥的常見原因，尋常魚鱗病。含有防腐劑苯扎氯銨的化妝品或洗衣產品可能是造成某些病例的原因。作為表面活性劑，苯扎氯銨可能會破壞細胞脂膜並使皮膚內的酶失活，從而誘導皮膚細胞（角質形成細胞）增殖、異常發育和刺激性接觸性皮炎。據報導，復發性彎曲性糙皮病[1]是無皂清潔皂中陰離子表面活性劑十二烷基硫酸鈉 (SLS) 的刺激性接觸性皮炎。這可能會引起皮膚細胞（角質形成細胞）的增殖和異常發育。皮膚微生物群的變化也受到指責。
symptoms_zh: 顆粒狀角化不全可表現為間擦皮疹（身體褶皺中的皮疹）或非間擦皮疹。它表現為紅色或棕色斑片狀鱗狀皮疹，最常見於腋窩或其他皮膚皺褶處。有時會很癢。在嚴重的情況下，皮疹廣泛擴散到整個軀幹。當它癒合時，皮膚會剝落（脫屑），類似於糙皮病中所見的剝落。顆粒狀角化不全 顆粒狀角化不全 顆粒狀角化不全 查看顆粒狀角化不全的更多圖像。
epidemiology_zh: 據報導，顆粒狀角化不全常見於中年女性，但據報導，嬰兒、兒童和所有種族的男性都會受到影響。

title: Granuloma annulare
snippet: Granuloma annulare can occur on any site of the body and is occasionally widespread. It only affects the skin. Granuloma annulare may cause no symptoms, but affected areas are often tender when knocked. The plaques tend to slowly change shape, size, and position.
causes: Granuloma annulare may be a delayed hypersensitivity reaction to a component of the dermis or a reaction pattern to numerous triggers. Reported triggering events have included many skin infections and infestations, and types of skin trauma. Inflammation is mediated by tumour necrosis factor alpha ( TNF α). The reason this occurs is unknown. There have also been a number of associations reported with systemic conditions including autoimmune thyroiditis, diabetes mellitus , other organ-specific autoimmune diseases, hyperlipidaemia , and rarely with lymphoma , HIV infection and solid tumours.
symptoms: Granuloma annulare can occur on any site of the body and is occasionally widespread. It only affects the skin. Granuloma annulare may cause no symptoms, but affected areas are often tender when knocked. The plaques tend to slowly change shape, size, and position.
epidemiology: Granuloma annulare is seen most commonly on the skin of children, teenagers, or young adults. The generalised form is more likely to be found in older adults ( mean age 50 years). There is a female predominance of 2:1 over males.
snippet_zh: 環狀肉芽腫可發生在身體的任何部位，並且偶爾會廣泛傳播。它只影響皮膚。環狀肉芽腫可能不會引起任何症狀，但受影響的區域在敲擊時通常會感到壓痛。斑塊往往會慢慢改變形狀、大小和位置。
causes_zh: 環狀肉芽腫可能是對真皮成分的遲發性超敏反應或對多種觸發因素的反應模式。報告的觸發事件包括許多皮膚感染和侵染以及皮膚創傷類型。炎症是由腫瘤壞死因子 α (TNF α) 介導的。發生這種情況的原因尚不清楚。據報導，許多與全身性疾病有關，包括自身免疫性甲狀腺炎、糖尿病、其他器官特異性自身免疫性疾病、高脂血症，很少與淋巴瘤、艾滋病毒感染和實體瘤有關。
symptoms_zh: 環狀肉芽腫可發生在身體的任何部位，並且偶爾會廣泛傳播。它只影響皮膚。環狀肉芽腫可能不會引起任何症狀，但受影響的區域在敲擊時通常會感到壓痛。斑塊往往會慢慢改變形狀、大小和位置。
epidemiology_zh: 環狀肉芽腫最常見於兒童、青少年或年輕人的皮膚。全身型更可能出現在老年人（平均年齡 50 歲）中。女性與男性的比例為 2:1。

title: Granulomatous cheilitis
snippet: Granulomas in Miescher cheilitis are confined to the lip. In other cases of granulomatous cheilitis, granulomatous disease is more widespread. The first symptom of granulomatous cheilitis is a sudden swelling of the upper lip. In most cases, this first episode goes away within hours or days. Swellin
causes: The causes of granulomatous cheilitis include: Allergic contact dermatitis Crohn disease Sarcoidosis Orofacial granulomatosis Cancer or infection resulting in obstruction of lymphatics around the lips A genetic disorder.
symptoms: Granulomas in Miescher cheilitis are confined to the lip. In other cases of granulomatous cheilitis, granulomatous disease is more widespread. The first symptom of granulomatous cheilitis is a sudden swelling of the upper lip. In most cases, this first episode goes away within hours or days. Swelling of the lower lip and one or both cheeks may follow in orofacial granulomatosis . Less commonly, the forehead, eyelids , or one side of the scalp may be involved. The swelling may feel soft, firm or nodular when touched. Recurrent attacks of granulomatous cheilitis may occur within days or even years after the first episode. At each episode, the swelling may become larger, more persistent and eventually become permanent. At this time the lips may crack, bleed and heal leaving a reddish-brown colour with scaling. This can be painful. Eventually, the lip takes on the consistency of hard rubber. Granulomatous cheilitis Granulomatous cheilitis Granulomatous cheilitis See more images of granulomatous cheilitis Other symptoms that may accompany granulomatous cheilitis include: Fever , headache and visual disturbances Mild enlargement of regional lymph nodes in 50% of cases Fissured or plicated (pleat-like effect) tongue in 20–40% of cases Facial palsy; this can be intermittent, then possibly permanent and can be unilateral or bilateral , and partial or complete. It occurs in about 30% of cases of granulomatous cheilitis and indicates progression to orofacial granulomatosis .
epidemiology: Granulomatous cheilitis is rare. It may occur in people of any race, sex and age, although onset is usually in early adulthood.
snippet_zh: 米歇爾唇炎的肉芽腫局限於嘴唇。在其他肉芽腫性唇炎病例中，肉芽腫性疾病更為廣泛。肉芽腫性唇炎的第一個症狀是上唇突然腫脹。在大多數情況下，第一集會在幾小時或幾天內消失。斯韋林
causes_zh: 肉芽腫性唇炎的原因包括： 過敏性接觸性皮炎 克羅恩病 結節病 口面部肉芽腫病 導致嘴唇周圍淋巴管阻塞的癌症或感染 遺傳性疾病。
symptoms_zh: 米歇爾唇炎的肉芽腫局限於嘴唇。在其他肉芽腫性唇炎病例中，肉芽腫性疾病更為廣泛。肉芽腫性唇炎的第一個症狀是上唇突然腫脹。在大多數情況下，第一集會在幾小時或幾天內消失。口面部肉芽腫病可能會導致下唇和一側或雙側臉頰腫脹。不太常見的是，前額、眼瞼或頭皮的一側可能受累。觸摸時腫脹可能感覺柔軟、堅硬或呈結節狀。肉芽腫性唇炎可能在首次發作後數天內甚至數年內反復發作。每次發作時，腫脹可能會變得更大、更持久，並最終成為永久性的。此時，嘴唇可能會破裂、流血並癒合，留下紅棕色並伴有鱗屑。這可能會很痛苦。最終，唇部呈現出硬橡膠的稠度。肉芽腫性唇炎 肉芽腫性唇炎 肉芽腫性唇炎 查看肉芽腫性唇炎的更多圖片 肉芽腫性唇炎可能伴隨的其他症狀包括： 發燒、頭痛和視力障礙 50% 的病例局部淋巴結輕度腫大 20-40% 的病例舌頭出現裂痕或褶皺（褶狀效應） 面癱；這可以是間歇性的，也可以是永久性的，可以是單側的或雙邊的，可以是部分的或完全的。它發生在約 30% 的肉芽腫性唇炎病例中，表明進展為口面部肉芽腫病。
epidemiology_zh: 肉芽腫性唇炎很少見。它可能發生在任何種族、性別和年齡的人身上，但通常在成年早期發病。

title: Granulomatous dermatitis
snippet: Granulomatous dermatitis presents with red or skin-coloured patches, papules, or plaques that can be round, annular, or cord-like. Lesions fluctuate in size and shape over days to months and are often asymptomatic.
causes: A variety of triggers can lead to granulomatous dermatitis, often related to autoimmune disease, inflammatory reactions, medications, or systemic conditions. The underlying mechanism involves granuloma formation in the dermis driven by chronic inflammation.
symptoms: Typical findings include red or skin-coloured patches, papules, or plaques. Lesions may be round, annular, or linear/cord-like. They wax and wane over days to months. Most patients are asymptomatic, but mild itch or burning can occur. Distribution is usually symmetrical on the trunk and proximal limbs. Middle-aged women are most commonly affected, and many patients have associated autoimmune disease.
epidemiology: Most common in middle-aged adults, especially women, and frequently associated with autoimmune disorders. Course is chronic with intermittent flares.
prognosis: Lesions may persist for months to years with fluctuating severity. Some improve spontaneously, while others require management depending on the associated systemic or autoimmune condition.
snippet_zh: 肉芽腫性皮炎會出現紅色或膚色的斑塊、丘疹或斑塊，形狀可呈圓形、環形或繩索狀，病灶大小在數天至數月間反覆變化，通常沒有明顯症狀。
causes_zh: 肉芽腫性皮炎可由多種因素引起，常與自身免疫疾病、慢性發炎反應、藥物或全身性疾病相關。主要機制為皮膚真皮層的肉芽腫形成，由持續性發炎所驅動。
symptoms_zh: 典型表現包括紅色或膚色的斑塊、丘疹或斑塊，形狀可呈圓形、環形或繩索狀。病灶會在數天至數月間反覆縮放。多數患者無症狀，但可能有輕度搔癢或灼熱感。分布常為軀幹及四肢近端的對稱性病灶。好發於中年女性，且常與其他自身免疫疾病並存。
epidemiology_zh: 最常見於中年族群，女性較多，並常與自身免疫疾病共存。病程慢性、反覆發作。
prognosis_zh: 病灶可能持續數月至數年並反覆變化。有些可自行改善，其他則需要依共病或全身疾病情況接受治療。

title: Guttate psoriasis
snippet: Acute onset over days Numerous small patches (<1 cm) Pink, scaly, thin patches or plaques of psoriasis Scale can be subtle in early lesions Widespread lesions predominantly over the trunk and limbs Lesions on the face, scalp, and ears tend to be faint and short-lived Guttate psoriasis See also Gutta
causes: Guttate psoriasis typically develops 1–2 weeks after a streptococcal infection of the upper respiratory tract, particularly tonsillitis, or other sites such as perianal streptococcal dermatitis . Beta- haemolytic streptococci can directly stimulate skin-homing T-cell proliferation in the tonsils. Guttate psoriasis has been reported to follow SARS-CoV-2 infection ( COVID-19 ) and other viral infections such as coxsackievirus. [see Enteroviral infections ]
symptoms: Acute onset over days Numerous small patches (<1 cm) Pink, scaly, thin patches or plaques of psoriasis Scale can be subtle in early lesions Widespread lesions predominantly over the trunk and limbs Lesions on the face, scalp, and ears tend to be faint and short-lived Guttate psoriasis See also Guttate psoriasis images
epidemiology: Guttate psoriasis tends to affect children and young adults; it is the second most common form of psoriasis in children after chronic plaque psoriasis . Both sexes and all races can develop guttate psoriasis. It is often the first presentation of psoriasis for an individual, but can also be seen in those with known chronic psoriasis.
prognosis: Psychosocial effects and impaired quality of life Complications of psoriasis eg, metabolic syndrome , non-alcoholic fatty liver disease [see Liver problems and psoriasis ] Dyspigmentation in skin of colour
snippet_zh: 幾天內急性發作 大量小斑塊 (<1 cm) 粉紅色、鱗狀、薄斑塊或銀屑病斑塊 早期皮損中鱗屑可能很細微 皮損廣泛分佈於軀乾和四肢 面部、頭皮和耳朵上的皮損往往是微弱且短暫的 滴狀銀屑病 另見 Gutta
causes_zh: 滴狀銀屑病通常在上呼吸道鏈球菌感染後 1-2 週發生，特別是扁桃體炎或其他部位，如肛周鏈球菌皮炎。β-溶血性鏈球菌可以直接刺激扁桃體中的皮膚歸巢 T 細胞增殖。據報導，滴狀銀屑病是在 SARS-CoV-2 感染 (COVID-19) 和其他病毒感染（如柯薩奇病毒）後發生的。[參見腸道病毒感染]
symptoms_zh: 幾天內急性發作 大量小斑塊 (<1 cm) 粉紅色、鱗狀、薄斑塊或銀屑病斑塊 早期皮損中鱗屑可能很細微 皮損廣泛分佈於軀乾和四肢 面部、頭皮和耳朵上的皮損往往是微弱且短暫的 點狀銀屑病 另請參閱點狀銀屑病圖像
epidemiology_zh: 滴狀牛皮癬往往會影響兒童和年輕人；它是兒童中繼慢性斑塊型銀屑病之後第二常見的銀屑病形式。男女和所有種族都可能患點狀牛皮癬。它通常是個體銀屑病的首次表現，但也可見於已知患有慢性銀屑病的人。
prognosis_zh: 心理社會影響和生活質量受損 牛皮癬的並發症，例如代謝綜合徵、非酒精性脂肪肝 [參見肝臟問題和牛皮癬] 膚色色素沉著

title: Hair loss
snippet: The features of hair loss depend on the cause. Actual symptoms such as itch and soreness are generally absent unless caused by accompanying inflammatory skin disease. However, a burning, prickly discomfort known as trichodynia may accompany hair shedding.
causes: Hair loss can be due to: The decreased growth of the hair: anagen hair loss Increased shedding of the hair: telogen hair loss Conversion of thick terminal hairs to thin vellus hairs; male and female pattern hair loss Congenital or acquired hair shaft abnormalities An inflammatory skin disease that damages or destroys the hair bulb.
symptoms: The features of hair loss depend on the cause. Actual symptoms such as itch and soreness are generally absent unless caused by accompanying inflammatory skin disease. However, a burning, prickly discomfort known as trichodynia may accompany hair shedding.
epidemiology: As all our hair follicles are formed during fetal growth, it is inevitable that we will notice hair loss of some kind in later life. Hair loss occurs in: Males and females Children and adults People with any colour or type of hair. Hair loss can be an isolated problem or associated with another disease or condition. It can be temporary or permanent, depending on the cause.
prognosis: Whatever the type of hair loss, it may be extremely distressing and embarrassing, reducing the quality of life and causing psychosocial problems . Loss of normal scalp hair increases the risk of: Sunburn Injury.
snippet_zh: 脫髮的特徵取決於脫髮的原因。除非由伴隨的炎症性皮膚病引起，否則通常不會出現瘙癢和酸痛等實際症狀。然而，脫髮可能會伴隨著一種被稱為毛蟲症的燒灼感、刺痛感。
causes_zh: 脫髮可能是由於： 頭髮生長速度減慢：生長期脫髮 頭髮脫落增加：休止期脫髮 濃密的終毛轉變為稀疏的毳毛；男性和女性型脫髮 先天性或後天性毛幹異常 一種損害或破壞毛球的炎症性皮膚病。
symptoms_zh: 脫髮的特徵取決於脫髮的原因。除非由伴隨的炎症性皮膚病引起，否則通常不會出現瘙癢和酸痛等實際症狀。然而，脫髮可能會伴隨著一種被稱為毛蟲症的燒灼感、刺痛感。
epidemiology_zh: 由於我們所有的毛囊都是在胎兒生長期間形成的，因此我們不可避免地會在以後的生活中註意到某種形式的脫髮。脫髮發生在： 男性和女性 兒童和成人 任何頭髮顏色或類型的人。脫髮可能是一個孤立的問題，也可能與另一種疾病或狀況有關。它可以是暫時的或永久的，具體取決於原因。
prognosis_zh: 無論哪種類型的脫髮，都可能令人極度痛苦和尷尬，降低生活質量並導致心理社會問題。正常頭皮毛髮的脫落會增加以下風險： 曬傷。

title: Halo naevus
snippet: A solitary halo naevus or multiple halo naevi are most often found on the trunk. They are less common on the head and are rare on the limbs. The affected naevi are dermal naevi that are congenital or have arisen during childhood. Halo naevi may follow the Koebner phenomenon , arising within a mole t
causes: Why halo naevi develop is not fully understood. They are currently classified as autoimmune in origin. The onset of a halo naevus may be triggered by sunburn or local trauma , which causes the mole to be recognised by the immune system as foreign, resulting in an attack by circulating antibodies and CD8+ T lymphocytes. The reaction also affects the normal skin around the mole, which also has pigment cells in it, causing depigmentation. Development of halo naevi has also been associated with psychosocial stress.
symptoms: A solitary halo naevus or multiple halo naevi are most often found on the trunk. They are less common on the head and are rare on the limbs. The affected naevi are dermal naevi that are congenital or have arisen during childhood. Halo naevi may follow the Koebner phenomenon , arising within a mole that has been injured in some way. The white halo is usually about 0.5–1.0 cm wide and is symmetrical (round or oval in shape). The halos develop at intervals round one or several moles, but not around all of them. There are four stages of a halo naevus. It may take several years to complete the cycle. Multiple halo naevi can be at different stages. Stage 1: A rim of pale skin surrounds a mole Stage 2: The mole may become pinker or less pigmented , and fades away Stage 3: A circular or oval area of depigmentation persists Stage 4: The affected skin gradually returns to its normal colour
epidemiology: Halo naevi (US plural, nevi) are not uncommon, with an estimated prevalence of 1% of the white-skinned population. They are usually seen in healthy children or young adults of either sex. They can occur at an older age too. Halos can be seen as part of a more generalised pigment loss, vitiligo , and halo naevi may also be associated with another autoimmune disease . They may rarely arise as a reaction to advanced melanoma and in patients with metastatic melanoma treated with targeted therapy or immune checkpoint inhibitors such as pembrolizumab or nivolumab .
snippet_zh: 單發暈痣或多發暈痣最常見於軀幹。它們在頭部較少見，在四肢則很少見。受影響的痣是先天性或兒童時期出現的真皮痣。暈痣可能遵循Koebner現象，在痣內出現。
causes_zh: 為什麼會出現暈痣尚不完全清楚。它們目前被歸類為自身免疫性疾病。暈痣的發病可能是由曬傷或局部創傷引發的，這會導致痣被免疫系統識別為外來物，從而導致循環抗體和 CD8+ T 淋巴細胞的攻擊。這種反應還會影響痣周圍的正常皮膚，其中也有色素細胞，導致色素脫失。暈痣的形成也與社會心理壓力有關。
symptoms_zh: 單發暈痣或多發暈痣最常見於軀幹。它們在頭部較少見，在四肢則很少見。受影響的痣是先天性或兒童時期出現的真皮痣。暈痣可能遵循科布納現象，出現在因某種原因受傷的痣內。白色光暈通常約0.5-1.0厘米寬，並且是對稱的（圓形或橢圓形）。光環間隔地圍繞一顆或多顆痣出現，但並非圍繞所有痣。暈痣有四個階段。完成這個週期可能需要幾年的時間。多個暈痣可能處於不同階段。第 1 階段：蒼白的皮膚邊緣圍繞著一顆痣 第 2 階段：痣可能會變粉紅色或色素減少，然後消失 第 3 階段：圓形或橢圓形的色素脫失區域持續存在 第 4 階段：受影響的皮膚逐漸恢復正常顏色
epidemiology_zh: 暈痣（美國複數，nevi）並不罕見，估計白種人的患病率為 1%。它們通常見於健康的兒童或年輕人，無論性別。它們也可能發生在年齡較大的時候。光暈可以被視為更普遍的色素脫失、白癜風的一部分，而光暈痣也可能與另一種自身免疫性疾病有關。它們很少是由於對晚期黑色素瘤的反應以及在接受靶向治療或免疫檢查點抑製劑（例如派姆單抗或納武單抗）治療的轉移性黑色素瘤患者中出現。

title: Hand dermatitis
snippet: Hand dermatitis may affect the backs of the hands, the palms, or both. It can be very itchy, often with a burning sensation, and is sometimes painful. It has acute, relapsing, and chronic phases. Acute hand dermatitis presents with: Red macules , papules , and plaques Swelling Blistering, weeping, c
causes: Hand dermatitis often results from a combination of causes, including: Genetic and unknown factors (constitutional hand dermatitis) Injury ( contact irritant dermatitis ) Immune reactions ( allergic contact dermatitis ). Hand dermatitis is frequently caused or aggravated by work when it is known as occupational dermatitis . Irritants include water, detergents, solvents, acids, alkalis, cold, heat, friction, and desiccating dusts. These can damage the outer stratum corneum , removing lipids and disturbing the skin’s barrier function. Water loss and inflammation lead to further impairment of barrier function. In atopic dermatitis , a deficiency in or defective function of the filaggrin protein in the stratum corneum leads to barrier dysfunction resulting in water loss and easy penetration by irritants and allergens [3]. Contact allergy is a delayed hypersensitivity reaction with elicitation and memory phases involving T lymphocytes and release of cytokines [2].
symptoms: Hand dermatitis may affect the backs of the hands, the palms, or both. It can be very itchy, often with a burning sensation, and is sometimes painful. It has acute, relapsing, and chronic phases. Acute hand dermatitis presents with: Red macules , papules , and plaques Swelling Blistering, weeping, crusting Fissuring. Features of chronic hand dermatitis include: Dryness and scale Lichenification. There are various causes and clinical presentations of hand dermatitis. Diffuse scale and redness on the palms due to eczema Infected hand dermatitis Hand dermatitis on the dorsal fingers in an atopic boy
epidemiology: Hand dermatitis is common, especially in young adult females, and accounts for 20–35% of all forms of dermatitis . It may occur at any age, including during childhood. It is particularly prevalent in people with a history of atopic dermatitis . [see also Atopic hand dermatitis ] Chronic hand dermatitis is estimated to affect 10–15% of the population and is a common cause of time lost from work. Hand dermatitis is particularly common in industries involving wet work or exposure to chemicals such as cleaning, catering, metalwork, hairdressing , healthcare , housework , construction, painting and mechanical work . This is mainly due to contact with irritants , but specific contact allergies can contribute [2].
prognosis: Bacterial skin infections ( staphylococci and/or streptococci ) can result in pustules , crusting, pain, and even limb lymphoedema. Dermatitis at the ends of the fingers may result in deformed nails. Dermatitis can spread to affect other sites, particularly the forearms and feet.
snippet_zh: 手部皮炎可能會影響手背、手掌或兩者。它可能會非常瘙癢，通常伴有燒灼感，有時還會疼痛。它有急性期、復發期和慢性期。急性手部皮炎表現為： 紅斑、丘疹和斑塊 腫脹 起泡、滲液、c
causes_zh: 手部皮炎通常由多種原因引起，包括： 遺傳和未知因素（體質性手部皮炎） 損傷（接觸性刺激性皮炎） 免疫反應（過敏性接觸性皮炎）。手部皮炎通常由工作引起或加重，稱為職業性皮炎。刺激物包括水、清潔劑、溶劑、酸、鹼、冷、熱、摩擦和乾燥灰塵。這些會損害外層角質層，去除脂質並擾亂皮膚的屏障功能。失水和炎症會導致屏障功能進一步受損。在特應性皮炎中，角質層中絲聚合蛋白的缺乏或功能缺陷會導致屏障功能障礙，導致水分流失，並且容易被刺激物和過敏原滲透[3]。接觸過敏是一種遲髮型超敏反應，具有誘發和記憶階段，涉及 T 淋巴細胞和細胞因子的釋放 [2]。
symptoms_zh: 手部皮炎可能會影響手背、手掌或兩者。它可能會非常瘙癢，通常伴有燒灼感，有時還會疼痛。它有急性期、復發期和慢性期。急性手部皮炎表現為： 紅色斑疹、丘疹和斑塊 腫脹 起泡、滲出、結痂 開裂。慢性手部皮炎的特徵包括： 乾燥和鱗屑苔蘚化。手部皮炎的病因和臨床表現多種多樣。手掌因濕疹而出現瀰漫性鱗屑和發紅 感染性手部皮炎 特應性男孩手指背側出現手部皮炎
epidemiology_zh: 手部皮炎很常見，特別是在年輕的成年女性中，佔所有形式皮炎的 20-35%。它可能發生在任何年齡，包括兒童時期。它在有特應性皮炎病史的人群中尤其普遍。[另請參閱特應性手部皮炎] 據估計，慢性手部皮炎影響著 10-15% 的人口，並且是導致工作時間損失的常見原因。手部皮炎在涉及濕工作或接觸化學品的行業中尤其常見，例如清潔、餐飲、金屬加工、美髮、醫療保健、家務、建築、油漆和機械工作。這主要是由於接觸刺激物，但特定的接觸過敏也可能導致[2]。
prognosis_zh: 細菌性皮膚感染（葡萄球菌和/或鏈球菌）可導致膿皰、結痂、疼痛，甚至肢體淋巴水腫。手指末端的皮炎可能會導致指甲變形。皮炎可以擴散到其他部位，特別是前臂和腳。

title: Hand, foot, and mouth disease
snippet: The illness usually begins with one or all of the following: fever , sore throat, loss of appetite, and lethargy. However, many children remain well in themselves despite the rash. The blisters usually appear 1–2 days following the fever. The incubation period is typically 3–6 days and children rema
causes: Enteroviral vesicular stomatitis (HFMD) is usually caused by the Coxsackie virus, most commonly the A16 subtype. It may also be caused by other viruses such as: Coxsackie A virus (5, 6, 7, 9, 10) Coxsackie B virus (2, 5) Enterovirus 71 Echoviruses. Enterovirus 71 infection is associated with more severe infections that may involve the heart, lungs, and can also cause inflammation of the lining of the brain ( meningitis ). Transmission occurs via direct contact with blister fluid or droplets spread from the mouth. It can spread very rapidly among family members or within a school. The virus can be shed in faeces and saliva for several weeks.
symptoms: The illness usually begins with one or all of the following: fever , sore throat, loss of appetite, and lethargy. However, many children remain well in themselves despite the rash. The blisters usually appear 1–2 days following the fever. The incubation period is typically 3–6 days and children remain infectious until the blisters have ruptured and healed (usually 7–10 days). Skin findings typically include: Blisters on the tops of the hands, feet and/or palms, and soles. Lesions usually: Feel tender Evolve over time from flat pink macules to small, elongated, red-greyish blisters Are often oval rather than round Peel off within a week, without leaving a scar. Small blisters ( vesicles ) and ulcers may develop in and/or around the lips and mouth and the back of the throat. These can sometimes be very painful. Oral intake may be significantly impacted, especially in infants and younger children. In children with eczema , or past eczema , blisters, flat red macules and papules may develop over other areas of the skin, especially the buttocks and sometimes on the arms, legs, and genital skin. Atypical HFMD can result in a more widespread rash and blistering. Features may include: Red, crusted macules and papules without blistering Large blisters ( bulla ) Targetoid ( bulls-eye , or target-shaped) lesions Nail shedding Involvement of atypical or unusual sites such as the ears. Hand, foot, and mouth disease Stomatitis in HFMD Oval vesicles on the sole in hand, foot and mouth disease Nail changes noted 6 weeks after hand and mouth blister resolution Oral hand, foot, and mouth disease Click here for more images
epidemiology: HFMD mostly occurs in children under 10 years of age with 95% of the cases occurring in toddlers aged under 5 years. However, it can also affect older children/adolescents. Adults, especially those who are immunocompromised , may also be affected. However, HFMD only rarely affects healthy adults. Hand, foot, and mouth disease is very common. The average annual incidence of HFMD has been reported as 90–2400 cases per 100,000 people in some countries.
prognosis: Severe complications are very uncommon in people that are otherwise healthy. They include: Dehydration due to inadequate fluid intake. This can cause significant problems in younger children. Fingernail and toenail changes are often noted about two months after HFMD infections due to coxsackie A6 infection. Transverse lines in the nail plate that slowly move outwards Onychomadesis (nail shedding) may occur about 2 months after the illness, however, eventually the nails return to normal. Serious enteroviral infection can lead to: Widespread blistering Enteritis Myocarditis Inflammation of the brain and or the lining of the brain (meningoencephalitis) Loss of nerve function in a limb ( acute flaccid paralysis ) Pulmonary oedema and pneumonia Haemorrhagic conjunctivitis In pregnancy, viruses that cause HFMD can cause first trimester spontaneous miscarriage or intrauterine growth restriction Meningoencephalitis, thrombocytopenia , disseminated intravascular coagulopathy , cardiomyopathy and hepatitis in the newborn have rarely been described.
snippet_zh: 該疾病通常以以下一種或全部症狀開始：發燒、喉嚨痛、食慾不振和嗜睡。然而，儘管出現皮疹，許多兒童仍保持良好的狀態。水泡通常在發燒後 1-2 天出現。潛伏期通常為 3-6 天，兒童可能會出現潛伏期。
causes_zh: 腸道病毒性水泡性口炎 (HFMD) 通常由柯薩奇病毒引起，最常見的是 A16 亞型。也可能由其他病毒引起，例如： 柯薩奇 A 病毒 (5, 6, 7, 9, 10) 柯薩奇 B 病毒 (2, 5) 腸道病毒 71 艾可病毒。腸道病毒 71 感染與更嚴重的感染有關，可能涉及心臟、肺部，也可能導致大腦內膜炎症（腦膜炎）。通過直接接觸水泡液體或從口腔傳播的飛沫進行傳播。它可以在家庭成員或學校內迅速傳播。該病毒可以在糞便和唾液中傳播數週。
symptoms_zh: 該疾病通常以以下一種或全部症狀開始：發燒、喉嚨痛、食慾不振和嗜睡。然而，儘管出現皮疹，許多兒童仍保持良好的狀態。水泡通常在發燒後 1-2 天出現。潛伏期通常為 3-6 天，兒童一直具有傳染性，直到水泡破裂並癒合（通常需要 7-10 天）。皮膚症狀通常包括： 手、腳和/或手掌和腳底出現水泡。病變通常： 感覺觸痛 隨著時間的推移，從扁平的粉紅色斑點演變為細長的紅灰色小水泡 通常是橢圓形而不是圓形 一周內剝落，不留疤痕。小水泡（水泡）和潰​​瘍可能會在嘴唇和口腔以及喉嚨後部內部和/或周圍形成。這些有時會非常痛苦。口服攝入量可能會受到顯著影響，特別是對於嬰兒和年幼的兒童。對於患有濕疹或既往濕疹的兒童，其他皮膚區域可能會出現水皰、扁平紅色斑疹和丘疹，尤其是臀部，有時還會出現在手臂、腿部和生殖器皮膚上。非典型手足口病可導致更廣泛的皮疹和水皰。特徵可能包括： 紅色、結痂的斑疹和丘疹，無水泡 大水泡（大皰） 靶樣（靶心或靶形）病變 指甲脫落 累及非典型或異常部位，例如耳朵。手足口病 手足口病引起的口腔炎 手足口病腳底出現橢圓形水泡 手足口水泡消退後 6 週出現指甲變化 口腔手足口病 點擊查看更多圖片
epidemiology_zh: 手足口病主要發生在10歲以下兒童，其中95%的病例發生在5歲以下幼兒。然而，它也會影響年齡較大的兒童/青少年。成年人，尤其是免疫功能低下的成年人，也可能受到影響。然而，手足口病很少影響健康成年人。手足口病很常見。據報導，在一些國家，手足口病的年平均發病率為每 10 萬人中有 90-2400 例。
prognosis_zh: 對於健康的人來說，嚴重的並發症很少見。它們包括： 由於液體攝入不足而導致脫水。這可能會給年幼的孩子帶來嚴重的問題。由於柯薩奇 A6 感染而感染手足口病約兩個月後，手指甲和腳趾甲通常會發生變化。患病後約 2 個月可能會出現指甲板橫向線緩慢向外移動，但最終指甲會恢復正常。嚴重的腸道病毒感染可導致： 廣泛起泡 腸炎 心肌炎 大腦和/或大腦內膜炎症（腦膜腦炎） 肢體神經功能喪失（急性弛緩性麻痺） 肺水腫和肺炎 出血性結膜炎 在懷孕期間，引起手足口病的病毒可導致妊娠早期自然流產或宮內生長受限新生兒腦膜腦炎、血小板減少症、播散性血管內凝血病、心肌病和肝炎很少被描述。

title: Heberden and Bouchard nodes
snippet: A Heberden node is a bony swelling of a distal interphalangeal joint and a Bouchard node is a bony swelling of the proximal interphalangeal joint. Bony swelling can affect either the lateral or midline aspects of the joint or both [1]. Multiple nodes can be present on one digit [2]. The nodes can af
causes: A Heberden or Bouchard node is due to an exostosis — a bony enlargement — and a sign of osteoarthritis. The cause of osteoarthritis is not fully understood. There is a genetic predisposition to the development of nodes [1]. Osteoarthritis is considered a sign of 'wear and tear' in a joint. The earliest structural abnormalities in osteoarthritis are evident in the ligaments supporting the joints [4]. The cartilage of the joints breaks down, osteophytes (bone spurs) develop , and the ends of the bones rub against each other. Inflammation in the nodes is due to friction-induced capsular rupture and synovial leakage [1].
symptoms: A Heberden node is a bony swelling of a distal interphalangeal joint and a Bouchard node is a bony swelling of the proximal interphalangeal joint. Bony swelling can affect either the lateral or midline aspects of the joint or both [1]. Multiple nodes can be present on one digit [2]. The nodes can affect one or many digits. Nodes most often affect the middle finger or thumb of both hands. They may grow slowly or rapidly. The nodes may become inflamed and painful but are often painless and unnoticed. A Heberden node may be associated with a digital myxoid pseudocyst . As well as affecting fingers, osteoarthritis causes discomfort, pain, and stiffness in other joints of the hands, knees, hips, and spine. Heberden node and myxoid pseudocyst
epidemiology: Heberden and Bouchard nodes are equally common in males and females of all races. They are common in older individuals. However, more than half of the patients with Heberden nodes and osteoarthritis are diagnosed before the age of 65 years [2]. Bouchard nodes are less common than Heberden nodes and are associated with more severe arthritis. The presence of the nodes is strongly familial [1]. More than 60% of patients with osteoarthritis of the knees have Heberden nodes [3].

causes_zh: Heberden 或 Bouchard 結節是由於外生骨疣（骨增大）和骨關節炎的症狀引起的。骨關節炎的病因尚不完全清楚。淋巴結的發育存在遺傳傾向[1]。骨關節炎被認為是關節“磨損”的徵兆。骨關節炎最早的結構異常在支撐關節的韌帶中很明顯[4]。關節軟骨破裂，骨贅（骨刺）生長，骨頭末端相互摩擦。節點炎症是由於摩擦引起的囊膜破裂和滑液滲漏造成的[1]。
symptoms_zh: Heberden 結節是遠端指間關節的骨腫脹，而 Bouchard 結節是近端指間關節的骨腫脹。骨腫脹會影響關節的側面或中線，或兩者兼而有之[1]。一位數字上可以出現多個節點 [2]。節點可以影響一位或多位數字。淋巴結最常影響雙手的中指或拇指。它們可能生長緩慢或快速。淋巴結可能會發炎和疼痛，但通常是無痛且不被注意的。Heberden 結可能與指粘液樣假性囊腫相關。除了影響手指外，骨關節炎還會導致手、膝蓋、臀部和脊柱等其他關節的不適、疼痛和僵硬。Heberden結節和粘液樣假性囊腫
epidemiology_zh: Heberden 和 Bouchard 結節在所有種族的男性和女性中同樣常見。它們在老年人中很常見。然而，超過一半的 Heberden 結節和骨關節炎患者在 65 歲之前被診斷出來[2]。Bouchard 結節比 Heberden 結節少見，並且與更嚴重的關節炎有關。節點的存在具有很強的家族性[1]。超過 60% 的膝骨關節炎患者存在 Heberden 淋巴結 [3]。

title: Henoch–Schönlein purpura
snippet: Classical purpura Ankle swelling ( arthritis ) Close-up of purpuric rash with vesicle (blister) formation Henoch-Schönlein purpura Henoch-Schönlein purpura Henoch-Schönlein purpura The classic presentation of HSP is with a tetrad of symptoms and signs: Rash Arthritis Abdominal pain Kidney impairment
causes: Although the precise cause of HSP is unknown, clinical evidence points to an infectious aetiology. The peak incidence of paediatric HSP is during the autumn and winter months. It often preceded by an upper respiratory tract infection and is found to cluster within families. Beta- haemolytic streptococci are often found on throat swab or there is positive streptococcal serology on blood testing. A multitude of other associations has been reported, including medications. These include ACE inhibitors , angiotensin II receptor antagonists, clarithromycin and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories. The underlying mechanism of small blood vessel inflammation is the deposition of IgA immunoglobulin within the blood vessel walls. This leads to leukocytoclastic vasculitis. A subtle defect of IgA may predispose people to develop HSP.
symptoms: Classical purpura Ankle swelling ( arthritis ) Close-up of purpuric rash with vesicle (blister) formation Henoch-Schönlein purpura Henoch-Schönlein purpura Henoch-Schönlein purpura The classic presentation of HSP is with a tetrad of symptoms and signs: Rash Arthritis Abdominal pain Kidney impairment. The symptoms are usually preceded by 2–3 weeks of fever , headache, muscle/joint aches, or abdominal pain. A rash is present in virtually all cases. It usually starts as red spots or bumps (which may have a ‘hive-like’ appearance) which rapidly change to small dark purple bumps ( palpable purpura ) within the first 24 hours. The most common sites of involvement are the lower legs, buttocks, elbows and knees. The rash is symmetrical and may even become generalised. Blisters and/or ulcers may develop in the affected areas. Arthritis is present in 75% of cases and usually involves one to four joints, especially the ankles and knees. It may be transient and move between different joints. Abdominal pain is present in half to three-quarters of patients and precedes the rash in up to one third. Abdominal pain may be associated with diarrhoea and bleeding from the bowel. Orchitis and intussusception are possible complications. Kidney involvement is seen in up to 50% of cases. It is usually mild and self-limiting , however, it is important that it is diagnosed and followed up as persistent impairment may occur. It normally occurs within a few days to one month after the onset of the other symptoms. Approximately 10% have serious kidney problems at presentation, 15% are left with subtle abnormalities in their urine tests, and 1–5% progress to end-stage kidney failure long term. Rarely other organs, such as the lungs, brain, and heart, are involved.
epidemiology: 75% of cases occur in children under the age of 10 years. It is thought by most researchers to be more common in girls, although some have found a male predominance or both sexes to be equally affected. HSP may occur in adults and when it does, it is often more severe and kidney damage is more common than is the case in children. There does not appear to be any racial predilection. The incidence in the UK is approximately 20/100000 children (under 17 years old) per year and the incidence of HSP thought to be similar in New Zealand. 15 to 40% of children have at least one recurrence.
snippet_zh: 經典紫癜 踝關節腫脹（關節炎） 紫癜皮疹特寫，伴有水皰（水泡）形成 過敏性紫癜 過敏性紫癜 過敏性紫癜 過敏性紫癜的典型表現有四聯症狀和體徵： 皮疹 關節炎 腹痛 腎功能損害
causes_zh: 儘管 HSP 的確切病因尚不清楚，但臨床證據表明其病因有傳染性。小兒HSP的發病高峰期是秋季和冬季。它通常先發生上呼吸道感染，並且被發現在家庭中聚集。咽拭子上經常發現β-溶血性鏈球菌，或者血液檢測中鏈球菌血清學呈陽性。已報導了許多其他關聯，包括藥物。這些藥物包括 ACE 抑製劑、血管緊張素 II 受體拮抗劑、克拉黴素和非甾體類抗炎藥。小血管炎症的根本機制是 IgA 免疫球蛋白在血管壁內的沉積。這導致白細胞破碎性血管炎。IgA 的細微缺陷可能使人容易患上 HSP。
symptoms_zh: 經典紫癜 踝關節腫脹（關節炎） 紫癜皮疹特寫，伴有水皰（水泡）形成 過敏性紫癜 過敏性紫癜 過敏性紫癜 過敏性紫癜的典型表現有四聯症狀和體徵： 皮疹 關節炎 腹痛 腎功能損害。症狀出現前通常會出現 2-3 週的發燒、頭痛、肌肉/關節疼痛或腹痛。幾乎所有病例都會出現皮疹。它通常以紅色斑點或腫塊（可能具有“蜂巢狀”外觀）開始，並在最初 24 小時內迅速變成小的深紫色腫塊（可觸及的紫癜）。最常見的受累部位是小腿、臀部、肘部和膝蓋。皮疹是對稱的，甚至可能變得全身性。受影響的區域可能會出現水泡和/或潰瘍。75% 的病例存在關節炎，通常涉及一到四個關節，尤其是腳踝和膝蓋。它可能是暫時的並在不同關節之間移動。一半到四分之三的患者會出現腹痛，多達三分之一的患者會出現皮疹。腹痛可能與腹瀉和腸道出血有關。睾丸炎和腸套疊是可能的並發症。高達 50% 的病例會出現腎臟受累。它通常是輕微的和自限性的，但是，重要的是對其進行診斷和隨訪，因為可能會發生持續性損害。它通常發生在其他症狀出現後幾天到一個月內。大約 10% 的人就診時患有嚴重的腎臟問題，15% 的人在尿液檢查中出現輕微異常，1-5% 的人長期發展為終末期腎衰竭。很少涉及其他器官，例如肺、腦和心臟。
epidemiology_zh: 75%的病例發生在10歲以下的兒童中。大多數研究人員認為這種情況在女孩中更為常見，儘管有些研究人員發現男性占主導地位或兩性都受到同樣的影響。HSP 可能發生在成人中，當發生時，通常比兒童更嚴重，腎臟損害也更常見。似乎不存在任何種族偏好。英國每年大約有 20/100000 名兒童（17 歲以下）患有 HSP，新西蘭的 HSP 發病率被認為與此相似。15% 至 40% 的兒童至少有一次復發。

title: Herpes simplex
snippet: Herpes simplex virus (HSV) causes recurrent blistering infections of the skin and mucous membranes, most commonly oral (HSV-1) or genital (HSV-2). After the primary infection, the virus becomes latent and reactivates periodically.
causes: Herpes simplex is caused by HSV-1 or HSV-2, members of the Herpesviridae family (double-stranded DNA viruses). HSV-1 usually causes oral/facial lesions, while HSV-2 usually causes anogenital infections, but either type can infect any skin or mucosal site. After primary infection, HSV becomes latent in dorsal root ganglia and can reactivate along sensory nerves, producing recurrent vesicles.
symptoms: Typical symptoms include grouped vesicles on an erythematous base, burning or tingling before an outbreak, painful erosions, and recurrent flares. Oral HSV causes cold sores, while genital HSV presents with genital ulcers, dysuria, or tender lymph nodes.
epidemiology: HSV-1 infections commonly occur in childhood, especially in crowded or low-resource settings. HSV-2 typically appears after puberty and is mostly sexually transmitted. HSV spreads through direct contact with active lesions; asymptomatic shedding also contributes to transmission but at a lower rate. Incubation is 2–12 days.
prognosis: HSV infections are chronic and recurrent. Severity and frequency of outbreaks vary by immune status. Antiviral therapy reduces duration and recurrence but cannot eradicate the virus.
snippet_zh: 單純皰疹病毒（HSV）會造成皮膚與黏膜反覆性的水疱感染，最常見為口唇（HSV-1）與生殖器（HSV-2）。初次感染後，病毒會潛伏並定期再活化。
causes_zh: 單純皰疹是由 1 型或 2 型 HSV 引起，皆為雙股 DNA 的皰疹病毒科成員。HSV-1 多見於口腔/臉部感染，HSV-2 多見於肛門生殖器感染，但兩者都能感染任何皮膚或黏膜部位。初次感染後，病毒潛伏在脊髓背根神經節內，之後沿感覺神經再活化，導致反覆的水疱。
symptoms_zh: 典型症狀為成群的水疱伴隨紅腫、發作前的灼熱或刺痛、疼痛性糜爛與反覆發作。口唇皰疹多為 HSV-1，生殖器皰疹則呈現生殖器潰瘍、排尿痛或淋巴結腫大。
epidemiology_zh: HSV-1 初次感染多發生於嬰幼兒，尤其在人口擁擠或資源較少的地區。HSV-2 多在青春期後出現，主要透過性接觸傳播。HSV 透過接觸活動性病灶傳染，也可經無症狀脫落傳播但機率較低。潛伏期為 2–12 天。
prognosis_zh: 單純皰疹為終身性且反覆發作。發作頻率受免疫狀態影響。抗病毒藥物可縮短病程與減少復發，但無法完全根除病毒。

title: Herpes zoster
snippet: Herpes zoster is characterised by dermatomal distribution , that is the blisters are confined to the cutaneous distribution of one or two adjacent sensory nerves. This is usually unilateral , with a sharp cut-off at the anterior and posterior midlines. The clinical presentation of herpes zoster depe
causes: After primary infection —varicella—VZV remains dormant in dorsal root ganglia nerve cells in the spine for years before it is reactivated and migrates down sensory nerves to the skin to cause herpes zoster. It is not clear why herpes zoster affects a particular nerve fibre. Triggering factors are sometimes recognised, such as: Pressure on the nerve roots Radiotherapy at the level of the affected nerve root Spinal surgery An infection An injury (not necessarily to the spine) Contact with someone with varicella or herpes zoster
symptoms: Herpes zoster is characterised by dermatomal distribution , that is the blisters are confined to the cutaneous distribution of one or two adjacent sensory nerves. This is usually unilateral , with a sharp cut-off at the anterior and posterior midlines. The clinical presentation of herpes zoster depends on the age and health of the patient and which dermatome is affected. The first sign of herpes zoster is usually localised pain without tenderness or any visible skin change. It may be severe, relating to one or more sensory nerves. The pain may be just in one spot, or it may spread out. The patient may feel quite unwell with fever and headache. The lymph nodes draining the affected area are often enlarged and tender. Within one to three days of the onset of pain, a blistering rash appears in the painful area of skin. It starts as a crop of red papules. New lesions continue to erupt for several days within the distribution of the affected nerve, each blistering or becoming pustular then crusting over. The chest (thoracic), neck (cervical), forehead (ophthalmic) and lumbar/sacral sensory nerve supply regions are most commonly affected at all ages. The frequency of ophthalmic herpes zoster increases with age. Herpes zoster occasionally causes blisters inside the mouth or ears, and can also affect the genital area. Sometimes there is pain without rash—herpes zoster "sine eruptione"—or rash without pain, most often in children. Pain and general symptoms subside gradually as the eruption disappears. In uncomplicated cases, recovery is complete within 2–3 weeks in children and young adults, and within 3–4 weeks in older patients. Herpes zoster Herpes zoster See more images of herpes zoster .
epidemiology: Anyone who has had varicella ( chickenpox ) may subsequently develop herpes zoster. Zoster can occur in childhood but is much more common in adults, especially older people. People with various kinds of cancer have a 40% increased risk of developing zoster. People who have had zoster rarely get it again; the chance of getting a second episode is about 1%. Herpes zoster often affects people with weak immunity.
prognosis: Involvement of several dermatomes , or sometimes, bilateral eruptions in unique dermatomes Eye complications when the ophthalmic division of the fifth cranial nerve is involved Deep blisters that take weeks to heal followed by scarring Muscle weakness in about one in 20 patients. Facial nerve palsy is the most common result (see Ramsay Hunt syndrome ). There is a 50% chance of complete recovery, but some improvement can be expected in nearly all cases Infection of internal organs, including the gastrointestinal tract, lungs, and brain ( encephalitis ) Herpes zoster is infectious to people who have not previously had chickenpox. Unlike chickenpox, herpes zoster in immunocompetent pregnant women is not associated with congenital varicella syndrome , intrauterine transmission of VZV to the foetus, miscarriage, or premature delivery.
snippet_zh: 帶狀皰疹的特點是皮節分佈，即水皰局限於一根或兩根相鄰感覺神經的皮膚分佈。這通常是單側的，在前中線和後中線處有銳利的截止。帶狀皰疹的臨床表現
causes_zh: 原發感染（水痘）後，水痘帶狀皰疹病毒在脊柱背根神經節神經細胞中保持休眠狀態數年，然後重新激活並沿著感覺神經遷移到皮膚，引起帶狀皰疹。目前尚不清楚為什麼帶狀皰疹會影響特定的神經纖維。有時會識別觸發因素，例如： 神經根受壓 受影響神經根水平的放射治療 脊柱手術 感染 受傷（不一定是脊柱） 與患有水痘或帶狀皰疹的人接觸
symptoms_zh: 帶狀皰疹的特點是皮節分佈，即水皰局限於一根或兩根相鄰感覺神經的皮膚分佈。這通常是單側的，在前中線和後中線處有銳利的截止。帶狀皰疹的臨床表現取決於患者的年齡和健康狀況以及受影響的皮區。帶狀皰疹的第一個症狀通常是局部疼痛，沒有壓痛或任何明顯的皮膚變化。它可能很嚴重，與一根或多根感覺神經有關。疼痛可能只發生在一個部位，也可能會擴散到各處。患者可能會感到非常不適，伴有發燒和頭痛。受影響區域的淋巴結常常腫大且有壓痛。疼痛發作後一到三天內，疼痛部位的皮膚會出現起泡的皮疹。它開始時是一片紅色丘疹。新的病變在受影響的神經分佈範圍內持續出現數天，每個病變都起泡或變成膿皰，然後結痂。胸部（胸椎）、頸部（頸椎）、前額（眼科）和腰椎/骶椎感覺神經供應區域在所有年齡段最常受到影響。眼部帶狀皰疹的發病率隨著年齡的增長而增加。帶狀皰疹有時會導致口腔或耳朵內出現水泡，也會影響生殖器區域。有時有疼痛但無皮疹（帶狀皰疹“正弦疹”）或有皮疹但無疼痛，最常見於兒童。隨著皮疹消失，疼痛和一般症狀逐漸消退。在無並發症的病例中，兒童和年輕人在 2-3 週內即可完全康復，老年患者則在 3-4 週內完全康復。帶狀皰疹 帶狀皰疹 查看更多帶狀皰疹圖片。
epidemiology_zh: 任何患有水痘（水痘）的人都可能隨後患上帶狀皰疹。帶狀皰疹可能發生在兒童時期，但在成年人中更為常見，尤其是老年人。患有各種癌症的人患帶狀皰疹的風險增加 40%。患過帶狀皰疹的人很少會再次患上帶狀皰疹。獲得第二集的機會約為1%。帶狀皰疹經常影響免疫力較弱的人。
prognosis_zh: 涉及多個皮區，或有時在獨特的皮區出現雙側皮疹 涉及第五腦神經眼部時出現眼部並發症 深部水泡，需要數週時間才能癒合，然後留下疤痕 大約每 20 名患者中就有 1 名出現肌肉無力。面神經麻痺是最常見的結果（參見拉姆齊亨特綜合徵）。有 50% 的機會完全康復，但幾乎所有病例都可以得到一定程度的改善。 內臟器官感染，包括胃腸道、肺部和大腦（腦炎） 帶狀皰疹對以前沒有患過水痘的人具有傳染性。與水痘不同，免疫功能正常的孕婦感染帶狀皰疹與先天性水痘綜合徵、水痘帶狀皰疹病毒宮內傳播給胎兒、流產或早產無關。

title: Herpetic whitlow
snippet: Patients typically present with a painful swollen digit , often the thumb or index finger. Possible prodromal fever and malaise. Localised itch, burning, and altered sensation (may precede vesicle formation). One or more (often clustered) 1–3 mm fluid-filled vesicles with surrounding erythema , most
causes: Autoinoculation through spread from other herpetic lesions such as oral or genital herpes . Direct exogenous inoculation from an external source. Viral reactivation following previous herpes simplex virus (HSV) type 1 or 2. HSV results in viral invasion and replication in epidermal and dermal cells, which can progress to involve the sensory dorsal root ganglion. Here, HSV remains and can be periodically reactivated to cause disease anywhere (including the fingertips). Patients may report preceding trauma such as a torn cuticle.
symptoms: Patients typically present with a painful swollen digit , often the thumb or index finger. Possible prodromal fever and malaise. Localised itch, burning, and altered sensation (may precede vesicle formation). One or more (often clustered) 1–3 mm fluid-filled vesicles with surrounding erythema , most often affecting the distal phalanx. Vesicular fluid is usually clear but can progress to become turbid, sero- purulent , or haemorrhagic. Vesicles can coalesce into larger bullae and can spread proximally. Proximal lymphangitis and lymphadenopathy may be observed. Typically, the vesicles will crust and desquamate over several weeks and resolve without any treatment. Other herpetic lesions (eg, oral or genital ) may also be present. The thumb or index finger are most commonly affected; it is unusual for more than one digit to be affected. View images of herpetic whitlow
epidemiology: One case series reported the incidence of herpetic whitlow as 2.4 cases per 100,000 people per year. Males and females appear to be equally affected. In young children, herpetic whitlow commonly occurs following oral herpes infection. This is thought to be related to thumb sucking causing autoinoculation from active herpetic lesions in the mouth. Herpetic whitlow in adults is more commonly associated with exposure to genital herpes , or occupational exposure of dental and other health care workers to patients with herpes simplex including oral secretions. People who are immunosuppressed are also more susceptible to herpetic infections.
prognosis: Superimposed bacterial or fungal infection and potential abscess development. Secondary herpes simplex infection including spread to oral, ocular , or genital areas. Recurrence (~23% in one paediatric review).
snippet_zh: 患者通常會出現手指疼痛腫脹，通常是拇指或食指。可能有前驅發熱和不適。局部瘙癢、灼燒感和感覺改變（可能先於水皰形成）。一個或多個（通常成簇）1-3毫米充滿液體的水皰，周圍有紅斑，大多數
causes_zh: 通過其他皰疹病變（例如口腔或生殖器皰疹）傳播的自身接種。從外部來源直接進行外源性接種。先前的 1 型或 2 型單純皰疹病毒 (HSV) 後病毒重新激活。 HSV 導致病毒侵入表皮和真皮細胞並進行複制，並可能進展到感覺背根神經節。在這裡，單純皰疹病毒仍然存在，並且可以定期重新激活，從而在任何地方（包括指尖）引起疾病。患者可能會報告先前的創傷，例如角質層撕裂。
symptoms_zh: 患者通常會出現手指疼痛腫脹，通常是拇指或食指。可能有前驅發熱和不適。局部瘙癢、灼燒感和感覺改變（可能先於水皰形成）。一個或多個（通常成簇）1-3 毫米充滿液體的水皰，周圍有紅斑，最常影響遠端指骨。水皰液通常是清澈的，但也可能會變得渾濁、膿性或出血。囊泡可以合併成更大的大皰並可以向近端擴散。可能會觀察到近端淋巴管炎和淋巴結腫大。通常，水皰會在幾週內結痂和脫落，無需任何治療即可消退。也可能存在其他皰疹病變（例如口腔或生殖器）。拇指或食指最常受影響；超過一位數字受到影響是不尋常的。查看帶狀瘰癧的圖像
epidemiology_zh: 一項病例係列報導，每年每 10 萬人中就有 2.4 例皰疹性瘭瘡發生。男性和女性似乎受到同樣的影響。在幼兒中，皰疹瘭瘡通常發生在口腔皰疹感染後。這被認為與吮吸拇指導致口腔活動性皰疹病變的自身接種有關。成人皰疹瘭瘡更常見與接觸生殖器皰疹，或牙科和其他醫護人員因職業接觸單純皰疹患者（包括口腔分泌物）有關。免疫抑制的人也更容易受到皰疹感染。
prognosis_zh: 疊加細菌或真菌感染和潛在的膿腫發展。繼發性單純皰疹感染，包括擴散到口腔、眼部或生殖器區域。復發（一項兒科檢查中約 23%）。

title: Hidradenitis suppurativa
snippet: Hidradenitis suppurativa is characterised by: Open and closed comedones Painful firm papules and nodules Pustules and fluctuant pseudocysts Abscesses Draining sinuses Hypertrophic or atrophic scarring with deformity Hidradenitis suppurativa typically affects intertriginous areas and can affect one o
causes: The exact cause of hidradenitis suppurativa is not fully understood. HS is described as an autoinflammatory syndrome , and its development is influenced by genetic , immune, hormonal, microbial, mechanical, and lifestyle factors. Hidradenitis suppurativa is not contagious, and it is not caused by poor hygiene. The early pathogenesis of HS is thought to involve follicular occlusion and rupture, an abnormal innate immune response, and a subsequent inflammatory cascade. Leukocytic infiltration , oedema , and bacterial dysbiosis within ruptured follicular units lead to inflammatory nodules and abscesses . Persistent inflammation results in extensive fibrosis , and late signs of HS consist of epithelial -lined, pus -draining tunnels deep in the dermis.
symptoms: Hidradenitis suppurativa is characterised by: Open and closed comedones Painful firm papules and nodules Pustules and fluctuant pseudocysts Abscesses Draining sinuses Hypertrophic or atrophic scarring with deformity Hidradenitis suppurativa typically affects intertriginous areas and can affect one or multiple sites: Axillae Neck Breasts Inframammary folds Sub-abdominal folds Inner upper thighs Groin Mons pubis Vulva /scrotum Perineum Buttocks Perianal area.
epidemiology: The global prevalence of hidradenitis suppurativa is estimated to range from 0.1% to 4%. However, underdiagnosis and misdiagnosis likely mean that the actual prevalence is higher. Delayed diagnosis is also common. HS typically presents following puberty by the second to third decades of life. Studies show that there is no racial predilection , although some surveys suggest it may be more common in African Americans. Risk factors for the development of HS: Sex — Female-to-male ratio of approximately 3:1 in Western countries, though perianal disease tends to be more common in men. Family history — One-third of patients report an affected first-degree relative. Obesity — Likely related to increased skin fold friction and chronic systemic inflammation ; childhood obesity is correlated with a higher risk of early-onset HS. Cigarette smoking — Possibly related to delayed wound healing and follicular occlusion due to nicotine and other components. Mechanical stress. Associated comorbidities: Metabolic syndrome Type 2 diabetes mellitus Cardiovascular disease Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) Acne Depression, anxiety, and suicidal ideation Other immune-mediated diseases eg, inflammatory bowel disease , spondyloarthropathy , non-infectious uveitis (possible association) Abdominal aortic aneurysm (slightly increased incidence ).
prognosis: Permanent scarring Secondary infection Psychosocial morbidity and reduced quality of life Chronic pain and impaired mobility Lymphatic obstruction and lymphoedema Squamous cell carcinoma Anaemia of chronic disease Systemic amyloidosis
snippet_zh: 化膿性汗腺炎的特徵為： 開放性和閉合性粉刺 疼痛、堅硬的丘疹和結節 膿皰和波動性假性囊腫 膿腫 引流鼻竇 肥厚性或萎縮性疤痕伴畸形 化膿性汗腺炎通常影響間擦部位，並可影響一側或另一處。
causes_zh: 化膿性汗腺炎的確切病因尚不完全清楚。HS被描述為一種自身炎症綜合徵，其發展受到遺傳、免疫、激素、微生物、機械和生活方式因素的影響。化膿性汗腺炎不具有傳染性，也不是由於衛生條件差引起的。HS 的早期發病機制被認為涉及濾泡閉塞和破裂、異常的先天免疫反應以及隨後的炎症級聯反應。破裂的毛囊單位內的白細胞浸潤、水腫和細菌失調會導致炎性結節和膿腫。持續的炎症會導致廣泛的纖維化，熱射病的晚期症狀包括真皮深處的上皮襯裡、膿液排出隧道。
symptoms_zh: 化膿性汗腺炎的特徵為： 開放性和閉合性粉刺 疼痛、堅硬的丘疹和結節 膿皰和波動性假性囊腫 膿腫 引流鼻竇 肥厚性或萎縮性疤痕伴畸形 化膿性汗腺炎通常影響間擦部位，並可影響一個或多個部位： 腋窩 頸部 乳房 乳房下皺襞 腹部下皺襞 大腿內側上部 腹股溝蒙恥骨 外陰/陰囊 會陰 臀部 肛周區域。
epidemiology_zh: 化膿性汗腺炎的全球患病率估計為 0.1% 至 4%。然而，診斷不足和誤診可能意味著實際患病率更高。延遲診斷也很常見。HS 通常在青春期後的第二個至第三個十年出現。研究表明，不存在種族偏好，儘管一些調查表明這種情況在非裔美國人中可能更常見。發生 HS 的危險因素： 性別 — 在西方國家，女性與男性的比例約為 3:1，但肛周疾病在男性中更為常見。家族史——三分之一的患者報告有受影響的一級親屬。肥胖——可能與皮膚褶皺摩擦增加和慢性全身炎症有關；兒童肥胖與早發性熱射病的較高風險相關。吸煙——可能與尼古丁和其他成分導致的傷口癒合延遲和毛囊閉塞有關。機械應力。相關合併症： 代謝綜合徵 2 型糖尿病 心血管疾病 多囊卵巢綜合徵 (PCOS) 痤瘡 抑鬱、焦慮和自殺意念 其他免疫介導的疾病，例如炎症性腸病、脊柱關節病、非感染性葡萄膜炎（可能相關） 腹主動脈瘤（發病率略有增加）。
prognosis_zh: 永久性疤痕 繼發感染 心理社會發病率和生活質量下降 慢性疼痛和活動能力受損 淋巴阻塞和淋巴水腫 鱗狀細胞癌 慢性病貧血 系統性澱粉樣變性

title: Hyperhidrosis
snippet: Hyperhidrosis can be localised or generalised. Localised hyperhidrosis affects armpits, palms, soles, face or other sites Generalised hyperhidrosis affects most or all of the body It can be primary or secondary.
causes: Primary hyperhidrosis appears to be due to overactivity of the hypothalamic thermoregulatory centre in the brain and is transmitted via the sympathetic nervous system to the eccrine sweat gland. Triggers to attacks of sweating may include: Hot weather Exercise Fever Anxiety Spicy food Causes of secondary localised hyperhidrosis include: The auriculotemporal syndrome ( gustatory hyperhidrosis) Stroke Spinal nerve damage Peripheral nerve damage, when it may be associated with cutaneous dysaesthesia Surgical sympathectomy Neuropathy A brain tumour Chronic anxiety disorder Causes of secondary generalised hyperhidrosis include: Obesity Diabetes Menopause Overactive thyroid Cardiovascular disorders Respiratory failure Other endocrine tumours , such as phaeochromocytoma Parkinson disease Hodgkin lymphoma Drugs : alcohol , caffeine, corticosteroids , cholinesterase inhibitors , tricyclic antidepressants , selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, nicotinamide and opioids
symptoms: Hyperhidrosis can be localised or generalised. Localised hyperhidrosis affects armpits, palms, soles, face or other sites Generalised hyperhidrosis affects most or all of the body It can be primary or secondary.
epidemiology: Primary hyperhidrosis is reported to affect 1–3% of the US population and nearly always starts during childhood or adolescence. The tendency may be inherited, and it is reported to be particularly prevalent in Japanese people. Secondary hyperhidrosis is less common and can present at any age.
snippet_zh: 多汗症可以是局部的，也可以是全身性的。局部多汗症影響腋窩、手掌、腳底、面部或其他部位。全身多汗症影響身體的大部分或全部。它可以是原發性的，也可以是繼發性的。
causes_zh: 原發性多汗症似乎是由於大腦下丘腦體溫調節中心過度活躍所致，並通過交感神經系統傳播到小汗腺。出汗發作的誘因可能包括： 炎熱的天氣 運動 發燒 焦慮 辛辣食物 繼發性局部多汗症的原因包括： 耳顳綜合徵（味覺多汗症） 中風 脊髓神經損傷 周圍神經損傷（可能與皮膚感覺障礙有關） 手術交感神經切除術 神經病 腦腫瘤 慢性焦慮症 繼發性全身多汗症的原因包括： 肥胖 糖尿病 更年期甲狀腺功能亢進 心血管疾病 呼吸衰竭 其他內分泌腫瘤，如嗜鉻細胞瘤 帕金森病 霍奇金淋巴瘤 藥物：酒精、咖啡因、皮質類固醇、膽鹼酯酶抑製劑、三環類抗抑鬱藥、選擇性血清素再攝取抑製劑、煙酰胺和阿片類藥物
symptoms_zh: 多汗症可以是局部的，也可以是全身性的。局部多汗症影響腋窩、手掌、腳底、面部或其他部位。全身多汗症影響身體的大部分或全部。它可以是原發性的，也可以是繼發性的。
epidemiology_zh: 據報導，原發性多汗症影響著 1-3% 的美國人口，並且幾乎總是在兒童期或青春期開始。這種傾向可能是遺傳性的，據報導在日本人中尤其普遍。繼發性多汗症不太常見，可出現於任何年齡。

title: Idiopathic guttate hypomelanosis
snippet: Idiopathic guttate hypomelanosis typically presents as smooth pale ( hypopigmented ) or white (depigmented) macules 2–5mm (range up to 1.5cm) in diameter most commonly on the sun-exposed aspects of the forearms, shins, and V of chest. Lesions are usually multiple and asymptomatic. Porcelain-white pa
causes: Although not fully understood, the aetiopathogenesis of idiopathic guttate hypomelanosis is probably multifactorial : Skin ageing Chronic sun exposure Genetic factors Other — trauma , autoimmune factors. Abnormal keratinocyte phagocytosis has been demonstrated resulting in reduced transfer of melanin from melanocytes.
symptoms: Idiopathic guttate hypomelanosis typically presents as smooth pale ( hypopigmented ) or white (depigmented) macules 2–5mm (range up to 1.5cm) in diameter most commonly on the sun-exposed aspects of the forearms, shins, and V of chest. Lesions are usually multiple and asymptomatic. Porcelain-white patch extending peripherally Three morphological variants have been described: Solitary or multiple hypopigmented macules on a background of sun-damaged skin Solitary white stellate sclerotic macule Small hypopigmented macules with a scalloped margin and hyperkeratotic surface. Wood lamp examination emphasises the loss of pigment.
epidemiology: Idiopathic guttate hypomelanosis can affect both sexes, all races, and all skin phototypes. Women and patients with skin of colour are most likely to present for medical attention. Idiopathic guttate hypomelanosis becomes more common with age, affecting <50% in the fourth decade (31–40 years), 50–80% of people over 40 years of age, and >90% in the ninth decade (81–90 years). It has been reported uncommonly in children and teens. Familial cases are common.
prognosis: Idiopathic guttate hypomelanosis is a benign condition of cosmetic significance. It can impact quality of life particularly in skin of colour.
title_zh: 特發性點滴狀黑色素減少症
snippet_zh: 特發性點狀黑色素減少症通常表現為直徑 2-5 毫米（範圍達 1.5 厘米）的光滑蒼白（色素減退）或白色（色素脫失）斑疹，最常見於前臂、小腿和胸部 V 形暴露在陽光下的部位。病變通常是多發性的且無症狀。瓷白帕
causes_zh: 雖然尚未完全了解，但特發性點滴狀黑色素減少症的發病機制可能是多因素的：皮膚老化、長期陽光照射、遺傳因素、其他因素——創傷、自身免疫因素。異常的角質形成細胞吞噬作用已被證明會導致黑色素從黑素細胞的轉移減少。
symptoms_zh: 特發性點狀黑色素減少症通常表現為直徑 2-5 毫米（範圍達 1.5 厘米）的光滑蒼白（色素減退）或白色（色素脫失）斑疹，最常見於前臂、小腿和胸部 V 形暴露在陽光下的部位。病變通常是多發性的且無症狀。向周邊延伸的瓷白色斑塊 已描述了三種形態變異： 日曬損傷皮膚背景上的單發或多髮色素減退斑疹 孤立白色星狀硬化斑疹 具有扇形邊緣和角化過度表面的小色素減退斑疹。木燈檢查強調色素的損失。
epidemiology_zh: 特發性點狀黑色素減少症可影響男女、所有種族和所有皮膚光型。女性和有色皮膚的患者最有可能就醫。隨著年齡的增長，特發性點滴狀黑色素減少症變得更加常見，在四十歲（31-40歲）中影響<50%，在40歲以上影響50-80%的人，在九十歲（81-90歲）影響>90%。據報導，這種情況在兒童和青少年中並不常見。家族病例很常見。
prognosis_zh: 特發性點狀黑色素減少症是一種具有美容意義的良性病症。它會影響生活質量，尤其是有色皮膚。

title: Immunoglobulin E tests
snippet: Immunoglobulin E (IgE) tests measure total or allergen-specific IgE levels to help evaluate allergic conditions, atopic dermatitis, asthma, and parasitic infections.
causes: IgE levels rise when the immune system reacts to allergens or parasites. Elevated results may be triggered by atopy, food allergens, environmental allergens, infections, or immune dysregulation.
symptoms: High IgE does not itself cause symptoms but reflects underlying allergic or atopic disease. Patients may present with eczema flares, urticaria, asthma symptoms, rhinitis, or food-related reactions.
epidemiology: IgE testing is widely used in individuals with chronic eczema, recurrent urticaria, suspected food allergy, or respiratory allergies. Total IgE varies significantly by age and atopic status.
prognosis: IgE levels may remain high in chronic atopic individuals. Results must be interpreted carefully, as high IgE alone does not confirm a specific allergy. Allergen-specific IgE may guide avoidance and management.
snippet_zh: 免疫球蛋白E（IgE）測試用來測量總IgE或特異性IgE，以協助評估過敏疾病、異位性皮膚炎、氣喘及寄生蟲感染。
causes_zh: IgE在免疫系統對過敏原或寄生蟲作出反應時上升。升高的結果可能與異位體質、食物過敏、環境過敏原、感染或免疫失衡有關。
symptoms_zh: IgE升高本身不會造成症狀，但反映背後的過敏或異位性疾病。患者可能出現濕疹惡化、蕁麻疹、氣喘症狀、鼻炎或食物相關反應。
epidemiology_zh: IgE檢測常用於慢性濕疹、反覆蕁麻疹、疑似食物過敏或呼吸道過敏者。總IgE會因年齡與異位性體質而有明顯差異。
prognosis_zh: 慢性異位性患者的IgE可能長期偏高。結果必須謹慎解讀，僅IgE升高不足以證實特定過敏原。特異性IgE則有助於指導避免措施與治療決策。

title: Impetigo
snippet: The initial erythematous macule in non-bullous impetigo may be more difficult to see on darker skin tones.
causes: Impetigo is caused by Staphylococcus aureus , and less commonly Streptococcus pyogenes .
symptoms: The initial erythematous macule in non-bullous impetigo may be more difficult to see on darker skin tones.
epidemiology: Impetigo is most common in young children but can occur at any age. It is usually transmitted through direct contact. Risk factors which may predispose an individual to impetigo include: Skin conditions: atopic dermatitis , contact dermatitis , scabies , chickenpox Skin trauma : lacerations, insect bites , thermal burns , abrasions Immunosuppression Warm, humid climate Poor hygiene Crowded environments.
prognosis: Wider spread infection: cellulitis , lymphangitis , and bacteraemia. Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome . Scarlet fever . Post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis: a rare, acute renal condition following infection with Streptococcus pyogenes (group A streptococcus). This is due to a type III hypersensitivity reaction and presents 2–6 weeks post-skin infection. Streptococcal toxic shock syndrome : a rare complication causing diffuse erythematous rash , hypotension , and pyrexia. Postinflammatory pigmentation . Scarring, particularly with ecthyma .
snippet_zh: 非大皰性膿皰瘡中最初的紅斑在較深的膚色上可能更難看到。
causes_zh: 膿皰瘡是由金黃色葡萄球菌引起的，較少見的是化膿性鏈球菌。
symptoms_zh: 非大皰性膿皰瘡中最初的紅斑在較深的膚色上可能更難看到。
epidemiology_zh: 膿皰瘡最常見於幼兒，但可發生於任何年齡。它通常通過直接接觸傳播。可能導致個體患膿皰瘡的危險因素包括： 皮膚狀況：特應性皮炎、接觸性皮炎、疥瘡、水痘 皮膚創傷：撕裂傷、昆蟲叮咬、熱燒傷、擦傷 免疫抑制 溫暖、潮濕的氣候 衛生條件差 擁擠的環境。
prognosis_zh: 更廣泛的感染：蜂窩織炎、淋巴管炎和菌血症。葡萄球菌性燙傷皮膚綜合症。猩紅熱。鏈球菌後腎小球腎炎：化膿性鏈球菌（A 組鏈球菌）感染後的一種罕見的急性腎臟疾病。這是由於 III 型超敏反應，在皮膚感染後 2-6 週內出現。鏈球菌中毒性休克綜合徵：一種罕見的並發症，導致瀰漫性紅斑皮疹、低血壓和發熱。炎症後色素沉著。疤痕，尤其是臁瘡。

title: Infantile haemangioma: Definition and pathogenesis
snippet: Infantile haemangiomas are typically solitary and most are located on the head and neck region (60%). Involvement of internal organs is usually indicated by multiple cutaneous lesions. The clinical features are determined by the depth of the lesion , distribution pattern, and phase of growth.
causes: A placental origin for infantile haemangioma is suggested due to GLUT1 protein expression. Fetal vascular origins are proposed due to the presence of primitive marker CD133 from the fetal cardinal vein. Defective vascular stem cell regulation involving endothelial progenitor cells (EPC), or extrinsic factors such as hypoxia and developmental vascular field disturbances can influence the development of vascular anomalies.
symptoms: Infantile haemangiomas are typically solitary and most are located on the head and neck region (60%). Involvement of internal organs is usually indicated by multiple cutaneous lesions. The clinical features are determined by the depth of the lesion , distribution pattern, and phase of growth.
epidemiology: Infantile haemangioma is found in 1–2% of newborns, and up to 10–12% at 1 year of age in Caucasian infants. It is less frequent in non-Caucasian populations. Girls are more commonly affected than boys (3:1). Risk factors for developing infantile haemangioma include: Low birth weight increases the risk by 40% for every 500g decrease in birth weight. Infantile haemangioma affects 1 in 4 preterm infants weighing under 1000g. Maternal factors carrying increased risk include: advanced maternal age, subfertility treatment, multiple pregnancy (eg, twins, triplets), pre-eclampsia , and placenta praevia.
title_zh: 嬰兒血管瘤：定義和發病機制
snippet_zh: 嬰兒血管瘤通常是孤立的，大多數位於頭頸部（60%）。內臟器官受累通常表現為多發性皮膚病變。臨床特徵由病變深度、分佈模式和生長階段決定。
causes_zh: 由於 GLUT1 蛋白的表達，提示嬰兒血管瘤起源於胎盤。由於存在來自胎兒主靜脈的原始標記 CD133，因此提出了胎兒血管起源。涉及內皮祖細胞（EPC）的血管幹細胞調節缺陷，或缺氧和發育性血管場紊亂等外在因素可能會影響血管異常的發展。
symptoms_zh: 嬰兒血管瘤通常是孤立的，大多數位於頭頸部（60%）。內臟器官受累通常表現為多發性皮膚病變。臨床特徵由病變深度、分佈模式和生長階段決定。
epidemiology_zh: 嬰兒血管瘤的發病率是 1-2% 的新生兒，而在 1 歲時，白種人嬰兒的這一比例高達 10-12%。在非白人人群中這種情況較少發生。女孩比男孩更容易受到影響 (3:1)。發生嬰兒血管瘤的危險因素包括： 低出生體重 出生體重每減少 500 克，風險就會增加 40%。嬰兒血管瘤影響四分之一體重低於 1000 克的早產兒。增加風險的母親因素包括：高齡母親、生育力低下治療、多胎妊娠（例如雙胞胎、三胞胎）、先兆子癇和前置胎盤。

title: Infectious mononucleosis
snippet: The clinical manifestations of infection are dependent on the interaction between virus and host immune system. The incubation period from contact until symptoms is usually 6-7 weeks.
causes: Infectious mononucleosis is a contagious viral infection usually caused by EBV (human herpesvirus-4, HHV4), a gamma-herpesviridae DNA virus. EBV is implicated in a wide range of human diseases, many of which have mucocutaneous manifestations that can be acute or chronic. Infectious mononucleosis can also be caused by cytomegalovirus (CMV) particularly in an older age group than the EBV-related patients.
symptoms: The clinical manifestations of infection are dependent on the interaction between virus and host immune system. The incubation period from contact until symptoms is usually 6-7 weeks.
epidemiology: Infectious mononucleosis typically affects young adults aged 15–25 years. It is equally common in both sexes and affects all races. Up to nearly 95% of people have had EBV infection by the time they are adults. The disease occurs worldwide with no seasonal predilection.
prognosis: Infectious mononucleosis complications include: Group A beta-haemolytic streptococcal pharyngitis Peritonsillar abscess Rupture of the spleen – athletes are advised to avoid sport in the first three weeks of illness Chronic active EBV infection – recurrent or persistent symptoms resembling infectious mononucleosis seen predominantly in Asian children. Life-threatening complications can occur.
title_zh: 傳染性單核細胞增多症
snippet_zh: 感染的臨床表現取決於病毒與宿主免疫系統之間的相互作用。從接觸到出現症狀的潛伏期通常為 6-7 週。
causes_zh: 傳染性單核細胞增多症是一種傳染性病毒感染，通常由 EBV（人類皰疹病毒 4，HHV4）（一種 γ 皰疹病毒科 DNA 病毒）引起。EBV 與多種人類疾病有關，其中許多疾病具有急性或慢性的皮膚粘膜表現。傳染性單核細胞增多症也可由鉅細胞病毒 (CMV) 引起，特別是在比 EBV 相關患者年齡更大的人群中。
symptoms_zh: 感染的臨床表現取決於病毒與宿主免疫系統之間的相互作用。從接觸到出現症狀的潛伏期通常為 6-7 週。
epidemiology_zh: 傳染性單核細胞增多症通常影響 15-25 歲的年輕人。它在兩性中同樣常見，並影響所有種族。高達近 95% 的人在成年時曾感染過 EBV。該病在世界範圍內都有發生，沒有季節性。
prognosis_zh: 傳染性單核細胞增多症並發症包括： A 組 β 溶血性鏈球菌咽炎 扁桃體周圍膿腫 脾破裂 – 建議運動員在患病前三週內避免運動 慢性活動性 EBV 感染 – 反复或持續出現類似傳染性單核細胞增多症的症狀，主要見於亞洲兒童。可能會發生危及生命的並發症。

title: Intertrigo
snippet: Intertrigo can be acute (recent onset), relapsing ( recurrent ), or chronic (present for more than six weeks). The exact appearance and behaviour depend on the underlying cause(s). The skin affected by intertrigo is inflamed, reddened, and uncomfortable. The affected skin can become moist and macera
causes: Intertrigo is due to genetic and environmental factors. Flexural skin has a relatively high surface temperature. Moisture from insensible water loss and sweating cannot evaporate due to occlusion. Friction from the movement of adjacent skin results in chafing. Intertrigo occurs more easily in environments that are hot and humid. Diabetes , alcohol , and smoking increase the likelihood of intertrigo, especially the infectious form. The microbiome ( microorganisms normally resident on the skin) on flexural skin includes Corynebacterium , other bacteria , and yeasts . Microbiome overgrowth in warm moist environments can cause intertrigo. Intertrigo is classified into infectious and inflammatory origins, but they often overlap. Infections tend to be unilateral and asymmetrical. Atopic dermatitis is usually bilateral and symmetrical , affecting the flexures of the neck, knees and elbows. Other inflammatory disorders also tend to be symmetrical affecting the armpits, groins, under the breasts, and the abdominal folds.
symptoms: Intertrigo can be acute (recent onset), relapsing ( recurrent ), or chronic (present for more than six weeks). The exact appearance and behaviour depend on the underlying cause(s). The skin affected by intertrigo is inflamed, reddened, and uncomfortable. The affected skin can become moist and macerated , leading to fissuring (cracks) and peeling. Intertrigo with secondary bacterial infection (eg, pseudomonas ) can cause a foul odour.
epidemiology: Intertrigo can affect males or females of any age. Intertrigo is particularly common in people who are overweight or obese (see metabolic syndrome ). Other contributing factors are: Genetic tendency to skin disease Hyperhidrosis (excessive sweating) Age Diabetes Smoking Alcohol . In infants, napkin dermatitis is a type of intertrigo that primarily occurs due to skin exposure to sweat, urine, and faeces in the diaper area. Toe-web intertrigo is associated with closed-toe or tight-fitting shoes. Lymphoedema is also a cause for toe-web intertrigo.
snippet_zh: 擦爛可以是急性的（最近發病）、復發性的（復發性的）或慢性的（持續六週以上）。確切的外觀和行為取決於根本原因。受擦爛影響的皮膚會發炎、發紅且不舒服。受影響的皮膚會變得潮濕和浸漬
causes_zh: 擦爛是由於遺傳和環境因素造成的。彎曲蒙皮具有相對較高的表面溫度。由於閉塞，無意識失水和出汗所產生的水分無法蒸發。鄰近皮膚運動產生的摩擦會導致擦傷。在炎熱和潮濕的環境中更容易發生擦爛。糖尿病、酒精和吸煙會增加擦爛的可能性，尤其是感染性擦爛。彎曲皮膚上的微生物組（通常存在於皮膚上的微生物）包括棒狀桿菌、其他細菌和酵母菌。溫暖潮濕環境中微生物過度生長會導致擦爛。擦爛可分為感染性和炎症性來源，但它們經常重疊。感染往往是單側和不對稱的。特應性皮炎通常是雙側且對稱的，影響頸部、膝蓋和肘部的彎曲。其他炎症性疾病也往往是對稱的，影響腋窩、腹股溝、乳房下方和腹部皺褶。
symptoms_zh: 擦爛可以是急性的（最近發病）、復發性的（復發性的）或慢性的（持續六週以上）。確切的外觀和行為取決於根本原因。受擦爛影響的皮膚會發炎、發紅且不舒服。受影響的皮膚會變得潮濕和浸漬，導致開裂和脫皮。繼發性細菌感染（如假單胞菌）的擦爛可引起惡臭。
epidemiology_zh: 擦爛病可影響任何年齡的男性或女性。擦爛在超重或肥胖的人中尤其常見（參見代謝綜合徵）。其他影響因素包括： 皮膚病的遺傳傾向 多汗症（出汗過多） 年齡 糖尿病 吸煙 酗酒。在嬰兒中，餐巾皮炎是一種擦爛病，主要是由於皮膚接觸尿佈區域的汗水、尿液和糞便而發生。腳趾間擦爛與封閉腳趾或緊身鞋有關。淋巴水腫也是趾蹼擦爛的原因之一。

title: Intraepidermal squamous cell carcinoma
snippet: Intraepidermal SCC presents as one or more irregular scaly plaques of up to several centimetres in diameter. They are often an orange-red colour but may also be brown. Although intraepidermal SCC may arise on any area of skin, it is most often diagnosed on sun-exposed sites of the ears, face, hands
causes: Ultraviolet radiation ( UV ) is the main cause of intraepidermal SCC. It damages the skin cell nucleic acids ( DNA ), resulting in a mutant clone of the gene p53, setting off uncontrolled growth of the skin cells. UV also suppresses the immune response, preventing recovery from damage. Human papillomavirus (HPV) is another major cause of intraepidermal SCC. Oncogenic strains of HPV are the main cause of squamous intraepithelial lesions (SIL), that is, squamous cell carcinoma in situ in mucosal tissue.
symptoms: Intraepidermal SCC presents as one or more irregular scaly plaques of up to several centimetres in diameter. They are often an orange-red colour but may also be brown. Although intraepidermal SCC may arise on any area of skin, it is most often diagnosed on sun-exposed sites of the ears, face, hands and lower legs. When there are many plaques, distribution is not symmetrical (unlike psoriasis ). Squamous cell carcinoma Squamous cell carcinoma Squamous cell carcinoma See more images of intraepidermal SCC ... Intraepidermal SCC may start to grow under a nail when it results in a red streak (erythronychia) that later may destroy the nail plate. Bowen disease of nail Bowen disease of nail Squamous cell carcinoma in situ
epidemiology: Risk factors for intraepidermal SCC include: Sun exposure: intraepidermal SCC is most often found in sun-damaged individuals. Arsenic ingestion : intraepidermal SCC is common in populations exposed to arsenic. Ionising radiation: intraepidermal SCC was common on unprotected hands of radiologists early in the 20th century. Human papillomavirus (HPV) infection : this is implicated in intraepidermal SCC on fingers and fingernails. Immune suppression due to disease (eg chronic lymphocytic leukaemia ) or medicines (eg azathioprine , ciclosporin ). Up to 50% of patients with intraepidermal SCC have other keratinocytic skin cancers, mainly basal cell carcinoma .
prognosis: Invasive SCC arises in about 5% of intraepidermal SCC lesions.
snippet_zh: 表皮內鱗狀細胞癌表現為一個或多個直徑可達數厘米的不規則鱗狀斑塊。它們通常是橙紅色，但也可能是棕色的。儘管表皮內鱗狀細胞癌可能發生在任何皮膚區域，但最常診斷為耳朵、面部、手部暴露在陽光下的部位
causes_zh: 紫外線（UV）是表皮內鱗狀細胞癌的主要原因。它會損害皮膚細胞核酸 (DNA)，導致 p53 基因突變克隆，引發皮膚細胞不受控制的生長。紫外線還會抑制免疫反應，防止損傷恢復。人乳頭瘤病毒（HPV）是表皮內鱗狀細胞癌的另一個主要原因。HPV致癌株是鱗狀上皮內病變（SIL）的主要原因，即粘膜組織中的原位鱗狀細胞癌。
symptoms_zh: 表皮內鱗狀細胞癌表現為一個或多個直徑可達數厘米的不規則鱗狀斑塊。它們通常是橙紅色，但也可能是棕色的。儘管表皮內鱗狀細胞癌可能發生在任何皮膚區域，但最常在耳朵、面部、手和小腿等暴露於陽光的部位診斷。當斑塊較多時，分佈不對稱（與牛皮癬不同）。鱗狀細胞癌 鱗狀細胞癌 鱗狀細胞癌 查看更多表皮內鱗狀細胞癌的圖像 ... 表皮內鱗狀細胞癌可能會開始在指甲下生長，導致紅色條紋（紅甲），隨後可能會破壞指甲板。指甲鮑文病 指甲鮑文病 原位鱗狀細胞癌
epidemiology_zh: 表皮內鱗狀細胞癌的危險因素包括： 陽光照射：表皮內鱗狀細胞癌最常見於受陽光損傷的個體。砷攝入：表皮內鱗狀細胞癌在接觸砷的人群中很常見。電離輻射：20 世紀早期，表皮內 SCC 在放射科醫生未受保護的手上很常見。人乳頭瘤病毒 (HPV) 感染：這與手指和指甲上的表皮內鱗狀細胞癌有關。由於疾病（例如慢性淋巴細胞白血病）或藥物（例如硫唑嘌呤、環孢素）引起的免疫抑制。高達 50% 的表皮內鱗狀細胞癌患者患有其他角質形成細胞皮膚癌，主要是基底細胞癌。
prognosis_zh: 約 5% 的表皮內 SCC 病變發生侵襲性 SCC。

title: Intralesional steroid injection
snippet: Intralesional steroid injection delivers corticosteroid directly into a skin lesion to reduce inflammation, flatten hypertrophic tissue, and soften abnormal scar formation.
causes: The treatment effect comes from local corticosteroid actions: reducing inflammation, inhibiting collagen synthesis, suppressing immune overactivity, and shrinking thickened or keloid tissue.
symptoms: Potential side effects include skin atrophy, depigmentation, telangiectasia, small dents at the injection site, temporary pain, and mild bleeding. Systemic effects are rare due to low absorbed dose.
epidemiology: This procedure is commonly used for keloids, hypertrophic scars, cystic acne nodules, alopecia areata patches, granulomas, and chronic inflammatory dermatoses.
prognosis: Most lesions flatten or soften after serial injections. Cosmetic improvement is generally good, though recurrence may occur, especially in keloids. Side effects are usually mild and localized.
snippet_zh: 病灶內類固醇注射是將皮質類固醇直接注入皮膚病灶，用來降低發炎、使增生組織變平，並改善疤痕硬塊。
causes_zh: 其作用來自局部類固醇效果，包括抑制發炎、減少膠原蛋白生成、降低免疫反應，以及縮小肥厚或蟹足腫組織。
symptoms_zh: 可能的副作用包含皮膚萎縮、色素變淡、毛細血管擴張、注射處凹陷、短暫疼痛或微量出血。因吸收量低，系統性副作用罕見。
epidemiology_zh: 此治療常用於蟹足腫、肥厚性疤痕、囊腫型痤瘡結節、斑秃病灶、肉芽腫以及慢性發炎性皮膚病。
prognosis_zh: 多數病灶在數次注射後會變平或變軟，外觀改善良好，但蟹足腫可能復發。副作用通常輕微且侷限於局部。

title: Irritant contact dermatitis
snippet: Irritant contact dermatitis: Resembles dermatitis of any cause Usually is confined to the site of contact with the irritant Is the commonest cause of hand dermatitis in occupational and non-occupational settings Burning and pain more common symptoms than itch Acute due to a single severe exposure Lo
causes: Irritant contact dermatitis develops when chemical or physical agents damage the skin surface faster than the skin can repair. Irritants remove oils and natural moisturising factor from the outer layer of the skin, allowing chemical irritants to penetrate the skin barrier and trigger inflammation. Factors influencing the development and severity of the dermatitis include: Concentration, amount, and properties of the irritant Duration and frequency of exposure, for example short concentrated or repeated prolonged low exposure Skin susceptibility such as pre-existing skin damage or atopic tendency Mechanical trauma including hand scrubbing Environmental factors such as temperature extremes or humidity. Everyday examples of common skin irritants are water, soaps , and, in the era of COVID-19 , hand sanitisers . Occupational irritants can include wet work, detergents, solvents, acids, alkalis, adhesives, and metalworking fluids. Topical medications such as retinoids and benzoyl peroxide, may cause irritant contact dermatitis with long-term use. Friction, sweating, and heat are examples of environmental factors. Irritant dermatitis is often the result of the cumulative impact of multiple irritants. Irritant dermatitis due to benzoyl peroxide Atopic irritant hand dermatitis Acute irritant contact dermatitis
symptoms: Irritant contact dermatitis: Resembles dermatitis of any cause Usually is confined to the site of contact with the irritant Is the commonest cause of hand dermatitis in occupational and non-occupational settings Burning and pain more common symptoms than itch Acute due to a single severe exposure Localised well-defined , redness, papules , swelling, blistering ( vesicles / bullae ) Example: kneeling in wet cement, which is very alkaline, causing severe dermatitis of the knees Chronic due to mild irritants or repetitive cumulative exposure Initial dryness and cracking of the skin Evolves to include inflammatory changes with redness and itch May develop tolerance or hardening with time Examples include dribble rash , napkin dermatitis , housewife’s eczema , ring dermatitis Interdigital dermatitis, also called the ‘sentinel sign ’, is regarded as an early stage of irritant contact dermatitis affecting the hands. It is commonly seen in occupations involving wet work. Sentinel sign DERMATITIS
epidemiology: Irritant contact dermatitis will affect anyone with sufficient exposure to irritants , but those with atopic dermatitis are particularly susceptible. Occupational hand dermatitis is due to irritants in 80% of cases, most often affecting those who involved in wet work such as cleaners , hairdressers , food handlers , and healthcare personnel . Irritant contact dermatitis can affect all age groups, both sexes, and any race.
prognosis: Disseminated secondary eczema Lichenification Secondary bacterial infection
snippet_zh: 刺激性接觸性皮炎： 類似於任何原因的皮炎 通常僅限於與刺激物接觸的部位 是職業和非職業環境中手部皮炎的最常見原因 燒灼感和疼痛比瘙癢更常見 症狀因單次嚴重接觸而引起急性 Lo
causes_zh: 當化學或物理因素對皮膚表面的損害速度快於皮膚的修復速度時，就會出現刺激性接觸性皮炎。刺激物會去除皮膚外層的油脂和天然保濕因子，使化學刺激物穿透皮膚屏障並引發炎症。影響皮炎發展和嚴重程度的因素包括： 刺激物的濃度、數量和性質 暴露的持續時間和頻率，例如短時間集中或反复長時間的低暴露 皮膚敏感性，例如預先存在的皮膚損傷或特應性傾向 機械創傷，包括手擦洗 環境因素，例如極端溫度或濕度。日常常見的皮膚刺激物包括水、肥皂，在新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 時代，還有洗手液。職業刺激物包括濕作業、清潔劑、溶劑、酸、鹼、粘合劑和金屬加工液。局部藥物，如類維生素A和過氧化苯甲酰，長期使用可能會引起刺激性接觸性皮炎。摩擦、出汗和熱量都是環境因素的例子。刺激性皮炎通常是多種刺激物累積影響的結果。過氧化苯甲酰引起的刺激性皮炎 特應性刺激性手部皮炎 急性刺激性接觸性皮炎
symptoms_zh: 刺激性接觸性皮炎： 類似於任何原因的皮炎 通常僅限於與刺激物接觸的部位 是職業和非職業環境中手部皮炎的最常見原因 燒灼和疼痛比瘙癢更常見 症狀因單次嚴重接觸而急性 局部邊界清晰、發紅、丘疹、腫脹、起泡（水皰/大皰） 示例：跪在濕水泥中，非常嚴重鹼性，導致膝蓋嚴重皮炎 由於輕微刺激物或反复累積接觸而形成慢性 皮膚最初乾燥和開裂 演變為伴有發紅和瘙癢的炎症變化 可能會隨著時間的推移產生耐受性或硬化 例子包括點滴皮疹、餐巾紙皮炎、家庭主婦濕疹、指環皮炎 指間皮炎，也稱為“哨兵徵”，被認為是皮炎的早期階段影響手部的刺激性接觸性皮炎。它常見於涉及濕工作的職業。前哨徵皮炎
epidemiology_zh: 刺激性接觸性皮炎會影響任何充分接觸刺激物的人，但患有特應性皮炎的人特別容易受到影響。80% 的情況下，職業性手部皮炎是由刺激物引起的，最常影響從事潮濕工作的人員，如清潔工、理髮師、食品處理人員和醫護人員。刺激性接觸性皮炎可影響所有年齡組、男女和任何種族。
prognosis_zh: 播散性繼發性濕疹 苔蘚樣變 繼發性細菌感染

title: Isotretinoin
snippet: Isotretinoin is an oral retinoid used for severe acne, reducing sebum production, inflammation, and abnormal follicular keratinisation.
causes: Isotretinoin works by shrinking sebaceous glands, lowering sebum output, normalising follicular keratinisation, reducing Cutibacterium acnes colonisation, and suppressing inflammation.
symptoms: Common side effects include dry lips, dry skin, nosebleeds, eye dryness, muscle aches, photosensitivity, and temporary acne flare. Laboratory abnormalities may include elevated lipids and liver enzymes.
epidemiology: Isotretinoin is widely used worldwide for severe acne, nodulocystic acne, acne scarring risk, and acne unresponsive to other treatments. Usage is tightly regulated in many countries due to its teratogenicity.
prognosis: Isotretinoin is highly effective and often results in long-term remission of severe acne. However, it is strongly teratogenic: fetal exposure during early pregnancy can cause miscarriage or major birth defects affecting the skull, heart, eyes, ears, and limbs.
snippet_zh: 異維 A 酸是一種口服維甲酸類藥物，用於治療嚴重痤瘡，可大幅降低皮脂、發炎與異常角化。
causes_zh: 異維 A 酸透過縮小皮脂腺、降低皮脂分泌、改善毛囊角化、抑制痤瘡桿菌與減少發炎反應來改善痤瘡。
symptoms_zh: 常見副作用包括嘴唇乾裂、皮膚乾燥、流鼻血、眼睛乾澀、肌肉痠痛、畏光，以及短暫的痤瘡惡化。檢驗可能出現血脂或肝酵素升高。
epidemiology_zh: 異維 A 酸全球廣泛用於嚴重痤瘡、囊腫性痤瘡、易留疤痤瘡或對其他治療無效的患者。因強烈致畸性，許多國家對其使用有嚴格規範。
prognosis_zh: 異維 A 酸對嚴重痤瘡的改善效果顯著，常能達到長期緩解。但孕期暴露會導致自然流產或重大畸形，影響顱骨、心臟、眼耳與四肢等發育。

title: Janus kinase inhibitors
snippet: Janus kinase (JAK) inhibitors are oral or topical medications that block JAK–STAT signalling pathways, used in inflammatory and autoimmune skin diseases.
causes: JAK inhibitors work by blocking Janus kinase enzymes involved in cytokine signalling. This reduces inflammation and immune overactivation, which are key drivers in diseases such as atopic dermatitis, alopecia areata, and vitiligo.
symptoms: JAK inhibitors are not a disease—they are treatments. Common treatment-related adverse effects include upper respiratory infections, acne-like eruptions, headache, gastrointestinal upset, and laboratory abnormalities such as elevated lipids or liver enzymes.
epidemiology: JAK inhibitors are increasingly used worldwide for immune-mediated skin diseases. Oral agents such as tofacitinib, baricitinib, and upadacitinib have been approved in many countries. Topical ruxolitinib is widely used for atopic dermatitis and vitiligo.
prognosis: When appropriately used, JAK inhibitors provide rapid improvement in inflammatory skin diseases. Long-term therapy may be required. Risks include thrombosis, infections, and laboratory abnormalities, requiring monitoring.
snippet_zh: Janus 激酶（JAK）抑制劑是口服或外用藥物，透過阻斷 JAK–STAT 訊號途徑來治療發炎與自體免疫性皮膚疾病。
causes_zh: JAK 抑制劑透過抑制 JAK 酵素，阻斷細胞激素訊號傳遞，減少免疫過度活化。主要用於異位性皮膚炎、圓禿、白斑等炎症性疾病。
symptoms_zh: JAK 抑制劑本身不是疾病，而是治療方式。常見副作用包括上呼吸道感染、類痤瘡皮疹、頭痛、腸胃不適，以及血脂或肝酵素升高等檢驗異常。
epidemiology_zh: JAK 抑制劑全球使用量快速上升。口服藥物（如 tofacitinib、baricitinib、upadacitinib）在多國獲批；外用 ruxolitinib 常用於異位性皮膚炎與白斑。
prognosis_zh: JAK 抑制劑能快速改善炎症性皮膚病，但部分患者需長期治療。風險包括血栓、感染以及檢驗異常，因此需定期追蹤。

title: Jessner lymphocytic infiltrate
snippet: Jessner lymphocytic infiltrate plaques usually start off as defined, small, slightly raised red spots that gradually enlarge peripherally to create a well demarcated red plaque. Sometimes the centre of the lesion is left clear, ie forming an annular and arciform shape. Single or multiple lesions may
causes: The cause of Jessner lymphocytic infiltrate is unknown. It is classified as a benign T-cell lymphoproliferative disorder. Some cases have been associated with Borrelia infection , the cause of Lyme disease . Cases of drug-induced Jessner lymphocytic infiltrate have been described due to duloxetine, ramipril, leflunomide, glatiramer acetate and ustekinumab .
symptoms: Jessner lymphocytic infiltrate plaques usually start off as defined, small, slightly raised red spots that gradually enlarge peripherally to create a well demarcated red plaque. Sometimes the centre of the lesion is left clear, ie forming an annular and arciform shape. Single or multiple lesions may occur and they range from 2 mm to 2 cm in diameter. Seasonal activity of Jessner lymphocytic infiltrate is variable: more patients deteriorate in winter than summer and yet flares may be associated with sun exposure. Usually, they are symptomless but some patients may complain of itching or burning.
