title: Seborrhoeic dermatitis
snippet: Seborrheic dermatitis is very common among patients of darker skin types. Studies have shown that it is among the five most common diagnoses observed in black patients. People of darker skin may present with scaly hypopigmented macules and patches in typical areas of involvement. Arcuate or petal-li
causes: The aetiology is not completely understood. Several factors are associated with the condition e.g. hormone levels, fungal infections , nutritional deficits, neurogenic factors. Proliferation of Malassezia yeast genus is believed to play a role. The lipases and phospholipases produced by Malassezia , a saprophyte of normal skin, cleave free fatty acids from triglycerides present in sebum. This may induce inflammation. Differences in skin barrier lipid content and function may account for individual presentations.
symptoms: Seborrheic dermatitis is very common among patients of darker skin types. Studies have shown that it is among the five most common diagnoses observed in black patients. People of darker skin may present with scaly hypopigmented macules and patches in typical areas of involvement. Arcuate or petal-like patches may be seen, termed petaloid seborrhoeic dermatitis. Children of colour often do not experience the classic cradle cap appearance of seborrheic dermatitis, but instead have erythema , flaking, and hypopigmentation of the affected areas and folds of skin. Seborrhoeic dermatitis around the hair line and forehead in skin of colour
epidemiology: Seborrhoeic dermatitis is a common skin condition affecting 3% to 12% of the population. It has a biphasic incidence occurring in infants and in adolescents and adults. Infantile seborrhoeic dermatitis affects babies under the age of 3 months and usually resolves by 6-12 months of age. Adult seborrhoeic dermatitis tends to begin in late adolescence. Prevalence is greatest in young adults and in older people. It is more common in males than in females. Seborrhoeic dermatitis often occurs in otherwise healthy patients. However, the following factors are sometimes associated with severe adult seborrhoeic dermatitis: Oily skin (seborrhea) Familial tendency to seborrhoeic dermatitis or a family history of psoriasis Immunosuppression : organ transplant recipients, human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) infection , and patients with lymphoma Neurological and psychiatric diseases: Parkinson’s disease, tardive dyskinesia, depression, epilepsy, facial nerve palsy, spinal cord injury, and congenital disorders such as Down syndrome Use of neuroleptic medications Treatment for psoriasis with psoralen and ultraviolet A (PUVA) therapy Lack of sleep, and stressful events.
prognosis: Secondary bacterial or fungal infection Skin thinning, dilated blood vessels , and steroid-induced telangiectasia Psychosocial impact due to appearance of skin
snippet_zh: 脂溢性皮炎在深色皮膚類型的患者中非常常見。研究表明，這是在黑人患者中觀察到的五種最常見的診斷之一。膚色較深的人可能會在典型的受累區域出現鱗狀色素減退斑和斑塊。弓形或花瓣形
causes_zh: 病因尚不完全清楚。有幾個因素與這種情況有關，例如激素水平、真菌感染、營養缺乏、神經源性因素。馬拉色酵母屬的增殖被認為發揮了作用。馬拉色菌（正常皮膚的腐生菌）產生的脂肪酶和磷脂酶可從皮脂中的甘油三酯中裂解出游離脂肪酸。這可能會引起炎症。皮膚屏障脂質含量和功能的差異可能是個體表現的原因。
symptoms_zh: 脂溢性皮炎在深色皮膚類型的患者中非常常見。研究表明，這是在黑人患者中觀察到的五種最常見的診斷之一。膚色較深的人可能會在典型的受累區域出現鱗狀色素減退斑和斑塊。可能會看到弓形或花瓣狀斑塊，稱為花瓣狀脂溢性皮炎。有色人種兒童通常不會出現脂溢性皮炎的典型乳痂外觀，而是受影響區域和皮膚褶皺出現紅斑、剝落和色素沉著。有色皮膚髮際線和額頭周圍的脂溢性皮炎
epidemiology_zh: 脂溢性皮炎是一種常見的皮膚病，影響 3% 至 12% 的人口。它在嬰兒、青少年和成人中具有雙相發病率。嬰兒脂溢性皮炎影響 3 個月以下的嬰兒，通常在 6-12 個月大時消退。成人脂溢性皮炎往往在青春期後期開始。年輕人和老年人的患病率最高。男性比女性更常見。脂溢性皮炎通常發生在其他健康的患者身上。然而，以下因素有時與嚴重的成人脂溢性皮炎有關： 油性皮膚（脂溢性皮炎） 脂溢性皮炎家族傾向或牛皮癬家族史 免疫抑制：器官移植受者、人類免疫缺陷病毒（HIV）感染和淋巴瘤患者 神經和精神疾病：帕金森病、遲發性運動障礙、抑鬱症、癲癇、面神經麻痺、脊髓損傷和唐氏綜合症等先天性疾病 使用抗精神病藥物 使用補骨脂素和紫外線 A (PUVA) 療法治療牛皮癬 睡眠不足和應激事件。
prognosis_zh: 繼發細菌或真菌感染 皮膚變薄、血管擴張和類固醇引起的毛細血管擴張 皮膚外觀造成的社會心理影響

title: Seborrhoeic keratosis
snippet: Seborrhoeic keratoses can arise on any area of skin, covered or uncovered, with the exception of palms and soles. They do not arise from mucous membranes. Seborrhoeic keratoses have a highly variable appearance. Flat or raised papule or plaque 1 mm to several cm in diameter Skin coloured, yellow, gr
causes: The precise cause of seborrhoeic keratoses is not known. The name is misleading, because they are not limited to a seborrhoeic distribution (scalp, mid-face, chest, upper back) as in seborrhoeic dermatitis , nor are they formed from sebaceous glands , as is the case with sebaceous hyperplasia , nor are they associated with sebum — which is greasy. Seborrhoeic keratoses are considered degenerative in nature. As time goes by, seborrhoeic keratoses become more numerous. Some people inherit a tendency to develop a very large number of them. Researchers have noted: Eruptive seborrhoeic keratoses can follow sunburn or dermatitis . Skin friction may be the reason they appear in body folds. Viral cause (eg human papillomavirus) seems unlikely. Stable and clonal mutations or activation of FRFR3, PIK3CA, RAS, AKT1 and EGFR genes are found in seborrhoeic keratoses. Seborrhoeic keratosis can arise from solar lentigo . FRFR3 mutations also arise in solar lentigines. These mutations are associated with increased age and location on the head and neck, suggesting a role of ultraviolet radiation in these lesions. Seborrhoeic keratoses do not harbour tumour suppressor gene mutations. Epidermal growth factor receptor inhibitors (used to treat cancer ) often result in an increase in verrucal (warty) keratoses.
symptoms: Seborrhoeic keratoses can arise on any area of skin, covered or uncovered, with the exception of palms and soles. They do not arise from mucous membranes. Seborrhoeic keratoses have a highly variable appearance. Flat or raised papule or plaque 1 mm to several cm in diameter Skin coloured, yellow, grey, light brown, dark brown, black or mixed colours Smooth, waxy or warty surface Solitary or grouped in certain areas, such as within the scalp, under the breasts, over the spine or in the groin They appear to stick on to the skin surface like barnacles. Seborrhoeic keratosis Seborrhoeic keratosis Seborrhoeic keratosis See more images of seborrhoeic keratoses See dermoscopy images of seborrhoeic keratoses
epidemiology: Seborrhoeic keratoses are extremely common. It has been estimated that over 90% of adults over the age of 60 years have one or more of them. They occur in males and females of all races, typically beginning to erupt in the 30s or 40s. They are uncommon under the age of 20 years.
prognosis: Seborrhoeic keratoses are not premalignant tumours. However: Skin cancers are sometimes difficult to tell apart from seborrhoeic keratoses. Skin cancer may by chance arise within or collide with a seborrhoeic keratosis. Very rarely, eruptive seborrhoeic keratoses may denote an underlying internal malignancy , most often gastric adenocarcinoma. The paraneoplastic syndrome is known as the sign of Leser-Trélat . Eruptive seborrhoeic keratoses that are not associated with cancer are sometimes described as having pseudo-sign of Leser-Trélat. Eruptive and irritated seborrhoeic keratoses may also arise as an adverse reaction to a medication, such as adalimumab , vemurafenib , dabrafenib , 5-fluorouracil and many chemotherapy drugs . An irritated seborrhoeic keratosis is an inflamed, red and crusted lesion. It may give rise to eczematous dermatitis around the seborrhoeic keratosis. Dermatitis may also trigger new seborrhoeic keratoses to appear.
snippet_zh: 脂溢性角化病可出現在任何有覆蓋或無覆蓋的皮膚區域，手掌和腳掌除外。它們不是由粘膜產生的。脂溢性角化病的外觀變化很大。扁平或凸起的丘疹或斑塊，直徑 1 毫米至幾厘米 膚色、黃色、灰色
causes_zh: 脂溢性角化病的確切原因尚不清楚。這個名稱具有誤導性，因為它們並不像脂溢性皮炎那樣局限於脂溢性分佈（頭皮、面部中部、胸部、上背部），也不像皮脂腺增生那樣由皮脂腺形成，也不與皮脂相關——皮脂是油膩的。脂溢性角化病本質上被認為是退行性的。隨著時間的推移，脂溢性角化病變得越來越多。有些人繼承了發展大量此類缺陷的傾向。研究人員指出：曬傷或皮炎後可能會出現爆發性脂溢性角化病。皮膚摩擦可能是它們出現在身體褶皺中的原因。病毒原因（例如人乳頭瘤病毒）似乎不太可能。在脂溢性角化病中發現了 FRFR3、PIK3CA、RAS、AKT1 和 EGFR 基因的穩定克隆突變或激活。脂溢性角化病可由日光性雀斑引起。FRFR3 突變也出現在日光性雀斑中。這些突變與年齡的增加以及頭部和頸部位置的增加有關，表明紫外線輻射在這些病變中發揮了作用。脂溢性角化病不含有抑癌基因突變。表皮生長因子受體抑製劑（用於治療癌症）通常會導致疣狀角化病增加。
symptoms_zh: 脂溢性角化病可出現在任何有覆蓋或無覆蓋的皮膚區域，手掌和腳掌除外。它們不是由粘膜產生的。脂溢性角化病的外觀變化很大。扁平或凸起的丘疹或斑塊，直徑 1 毫米到幾厘米 膚色、黃色、灰色、淺棕色、深棕色、黑色或混合顏色 光滑、蠟質或疣狀表面 單個或成群出現在某些區域，例如頭皮內、乳房下方、脊柱上方或腹股溝 它們看起來像藤壺一樣粘附在皮膚表面。脂溢性角化病 脂溢性角化病 脂溢性角化病 查看脂溢性角化病的更多圖片 查看脂溢性角化病的皮膚鏡檢查圖像
epidemiology_zh: 脂溢性角化病極為常見。據估計，超過 90% 的 60 歲以上成年人患有其中一種或多種。它們發生在所有種族的男性和女性身上，通常在 30 多歲或 40 多歲開始爆發。20歲以下的人並不常見。
prognosis_zh: 脂溢性角化病不是癌前腫瘤。然而：皮膚癌有時很難與脂溢性角化病區分開。皮膚癌可能偶然發生在脂溢性角化病中或與脂溢性角化病同時發生。極少數情況下，爆發性脂溢性角化病可能表示潛在的內部惡性腫瘤，最常見的是胃腺癌。副腫瘤綜合徵被稱為 Leser-Trélat 徵兆。與癌症無關的爆發性脂溢性角化病有時被描述為具有 Leser-Trélat 假徵象。爆發性和刺激性脂溢性角化病也可能因藥物的不良反應而出現，例如阿達木單抗、維莫非尼、達拉非尼、5-氟尿嘧啶和許多化療藥物。刺激性脂溢性角化病是一種發炎、發紅、結痂的病變。它可能會引起脂溢性角化病周圍的濕疹性皮炎。皮炎也可能引發新的脂溢性角化病的出現。

title: Seborrhoeic keratosis images
snippet: Image collection showing the typical appearance of seborrhoeic keratoses, benign warty or waxy growths commonly seen in older adults.
causes: Seborrhoeic keratosis arises from benign proliferation of epidermal keratinocytes. The exact cause is unknown but is associated with ageing and genetics.
symptoms: Lesions appear as well-defined, warty, waxy, or stuck-on plaques that vary in colour from light brown to black.
snippet_zh: 此頁展示脂溢性角化病的典型外觀，包括常見於中老年人的良性疣狀或蠟狀增生。
causes_zh: 脂溢性角化病源於表皮角質細胞的良性增生，確切原因不明，與老化及遺傳相關。
symptoms_zh: 皮損呈界線清楚的疣狀、蠟狀或貼附感斑塊，顏色可由淺褐到黑色不等。

title: Fitzpatrick skin phototype
snippet: The Fitzpatrick skin phototype classification categorizes skin based on its response to ultraviolet (UV) radiation, particularly how easily it burns or tans.
causes: Skin phototype is determined by genetic factors influencing baseline pigmentation and the skin's biological response to ultraviolet (UV) radiation.
symptoms: Each skin phototype demonstrates characteristic reactions to UV exposure, ranging from burning easily with minimal tanning to rarely burning and tanning deeply.
title_zh: 菲茨帕特里克皮膚光型
snippet_zh: 菲茨帕特里克皮膚光型分類依據皮膚在紫外線照射下容易曬傷或變黑的程度來劃分不同類型。
causes_zh: 皮膚光型由遺傳因素決定，影響基礎膚色及皮膚對紫外線的生物反應。
symptoms_zh: 不同皮膚光型在紫外線曝曬下呈現特徵性反應，從容易曬傷且不易變黑，到很少曬傷並容易曬黑。

title: Solar lentigo
snippet: Solar lentigo refers to well-defined, flat brown spots caused by long-term sun exposure. It is commonly seen on the face, hands, and other sun-exposed areas.
causes: Chronic ultraviolet (UV) radiation stimulates increased melanocyte activity, leading to pigment accumulation. Ageing and cumulative sun damage are major contributors.
symptoms: Light to dark brown flat macules with sharp borders on sun-exposed skin. Typically asymptomatic and discovered for cosmetic reasons.
snippet_zh: 日光性雀斑是長期日曬造成的界線清楚、扁平棕色斑點，常見於臉部、手部等曝曬部位。
causes_zh: 長期紫外線照射使黑色素細胞活性增加、色素沉積。老化與累積性日曬傷害是主要原因。
symptoms_zh: 曝曬部位出現淺至深棕色、邊界清楚的扁平斑點，通常無症狀，多因外觀問題被注意到。

title: Stevens–Johnson syndrome / toxic epidermal necrolysis
snippet: SJS/TEN usually develops within the first week of antibiotic therapy but up to 2 months after starting an anticonvulsant. For most drugs, the onset is within a few days up to 1 month. Before the rash appears, there is usually a prodromal illness of several days duration resembling an upper respirato
causes: SJS/TEN is a rare and unpredictable reaction to a medication. The mechanism has still not been understood and is complex. Drug-specific CD8+ cytotoxic lymphocytes can be detected in the early blister fluid. They have some natural killer cell activity and can probably kill keratinocytes by direct contact. Cytokines implicated include perforin/granzyme, granulysin, Fas-L and tumour necrosis factor alpha ( TNF α). There are probably two major pathways involved: Fas-Fas ligand pathway of apoptosis has been considered a pivotal step in the pathogenesis of TEN. The Fas ligand (FasL), a form of tumour necrosis factor, is secreted by blood lymphocytes and can bind to the Fas ‘death’ receptor expressed by keratinocytes. Granule -mediated exocytosis via perforin and granzyme B resulting in cytotoxicity (cell death). Perforin and granzyme B can be detected in early blister fluid, and it has been suggested that levels may be associated with disease severity.
symptoms: SJS/TEN usually develops within the first week of antibiotic therapy but up to 2 months after starting an anticonvulsant. For most drugs, the onset is within a few days up to 1 month. Before the rash appears, there is usually a prodromal illness of several days duration resembling an upper respiratory tract infection or 'flu-like illness. Symptoms may include: Fever > 39 C Sore throat, difficulty swallowing Runny nose and cough Sore red eyes, conjunctivitis General aches and pains. There is then an abrupt onset of a tender/painful red skin rash starting on the trunk and extending rapidly over hours to days onto the face and limbs (but rarely affecting the scalp, palms or soles). The maximum extent is usually reached by four days. The skin lesions may be: Macules — flat, red and diffuse ( measles -like spots) or purple ( purpuric ) spots Diffuse erythema Targetoid — as in erythema multiforme Blisters — flaccid (ie, not tense). The blisters then merge to form sheets of skin detachment, exposing red, oozing dermis. The Nikolsky sign is positive in areas of skin redness. This means that blisters and erosions appear when the skin is rubbed gently. Toxic epidermal necrolysis Toxic epidermal necrolysis Toxic epidermal necrolysis Mucosal involvement is prominent and severe, although not forming actual blisters. At least two mucosal surfaces are affected including: Eyes (conjunctivitis, less often corneal ulceration , anterior uveitis , panophthalmitis) — red, sore, sticky, photosensitive eyes Lips/mouth (cheilitis, stomatitis ) — red crusted lips, painful mouth ulcers Pharynx , oesophagus — causing difficulty eating Genital area and urinary tract — erosions, ulcers , urinary retention Upper respiratory tract (trachea and bronchi) — cough and respiratory distress Gastrointestinal tract — diarrhoea. The patient is very ill, extremely anxious and in considerable pain. In addition to skin/mucosal involvement, other organs may be affected including liver, kidneys, lungs, bone marrow and joints. Toxic epidermal necrolysis Stevens Johnson Syndrome Stevens Johnson Syndrome
epidemiology: SJS/TEN is a very rare complication of medication use (estimated at 1–2/million each year for SJS, and 0.4–1.2/million each year for TEN). Anyone on medication can develop SJS/TEN unpredictably. It can affect all age groups and all races. It is slightly more common in females than in males. It is 100 times more common in association with human immunodeficiency virus infection ( HIV ). Genetic factors are important. There are HLA associations in some races to anticonvulsants and allopurinol. Polymorphisms to specific genes have been detected (eg, CYP2C coding for cytochrome P450 in patients reacting to anticonvulsants). More than 200 medications have been reported in association with SJS/TEN. It is more often seen with drugs with long half-lives compared to even a chemically similar related drug with a short half-life. A half-life of a medication is the time that half of the delivered dose remains circulating in the body. The medications are usually systemic (taken by mouth or injection), but TEN has been reported after topical use. No drug is implicated in about 20% of cases SJS/TEN has rarely been associated with vaccination and infections such as mycoplasma and cytomegalovirus. Infections are generally associated with mucosal involvement and less severe cutaneous disease than when drugs are the cause. The drugs that most commonly cause SJS/TEN are antibiotics in 40%. Other drugs include: Sulfonamides : cotrimoxazole Beta-lactam: penicillins, cephalosporins Anti-convulsants: lamotrigine, carbamazepine, phenytoin, phenobarbitone Allopurinol Paracetamol/acetaminophen Nevirapine (non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor ) Nonsteroidal anti- inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) (oxicam type mainly) The anticancer drugs, PD-1 inhibitors. Other triggers of SJS/TEN .
prognosis: SJS/TEN can be fatal due to complications in the acute phase. The mortality rate is up to 10% for SJS and at least 30% for TEN. During the acute phase, potentially fatal complications include: Dehydration and acute malnutrition Infection of skin, mucous membranes, lungs (pneumonia), septicaemia (blood poisoning) with bacteria and Candida Acute respiratory distress syndrome Gastrointestinal ulceration, perforation and intussusception Shock and multiple organ failure including kidney failure Thromboembolism and disseminated intravascular coagulopathy.
title_zh: 史蒂文斯-約翰遜綜合徵/中毒性表皮壞死松解症
snippet_zh: SJS/TEN 通常在抗生素治療的第一周內發生，但在開始抗驚厥藥物後最多 2 個月內發生。對於大多數藥物，起效時間為幾天至 1 個月。在出現皮疹之前，通常會出現持續數天的前驅疾病，類似於上呼吸道疾病
causes_zh: SJS/TEN 是一種罕見且不可預測的藥物反應。該機制尚未被理解並且很複雜。早期皰液中可檢測到藥物特異性CD8+細胞毒性淋巴細胞。它們具有一些自然殺傷細胞活性，可能可以通過直接接觸殺死角質形成細胞。涉及的細胞因子包括穿孔素/顆粒酶、顆粒溶素、Fas-L 和腫瘤壞死因子 α (TNF α)。可能涉及兩條主要途徑： 凋亡的Fas-Fas配體途徑被認為是TEN發病機制中的關鍵步驟。Fas 配體 (FasL) 是腫瘤壞死因子的一種形式，由血液淋巴細胞分泌，可以與角質形成細胞表達的 Fas“死亡”受體結合。顆粒介導的胞吐作用通過穿孔素和顆粒酶 B 導致細胞毒性（細胞死亡）。早期水皰液中可檢測到穿孔素和顆粒酶 B，有人認為其水平可能與疾病嚴重程度相關。
symptoms_zh: SJS/TEN 通常在抗生素治療的第一周內發生，但在開始抗驚厥藥物後最多 2 個月內發生。對於大多數藥物，起效時間為幾天至 1 個月。在出現皮疹之前，通常會出現持續數天的前驅疾病，類似於上呼吸道感染或“流感樣疾病”。症狀可能包括： 發燒 > 39 C 喉嚨痛、吞嚥困難 流鼻涕和咳嗽 眼睛發紅、結膜炎 全身疼痛。然後突然出現柔軟/疼痛的紅色皮疹，從軀幹開始，在數小時至數天內迅速蔓延至面部和四肢（但很少影響頭皮、手掌或腳底）。通常四天后即可達到最大程度。皮膚病變可能是： 斑疹 — 扁平、紅色和瀰漫性（麻疹樣斑點）或紫色（紫癜）斑點 瀰漫性紅斑 目標樣 — 如多形紅斑 水泡 — 鬆弛（即不緊張）。然後水泡合併形成一片片皮膚脫落，露出紅色、滲出的真皮。皮膚發紅區域的尼科爾斯基徵呈陽性。這意味著輕輕摩擦皮膚時會出現水泡和糜爛。中毒性表皮壞死松解症 中毒性表皮壞死松解症 中毒性表皮壞死松解症 粘膜受累明顯且嚴重，但未形成實際水皰。至少兩個粘膜表面受到影響，包括： 眼睛（結膜炎、較少見的角膜潰瘍、前葡萄膜炎、全眼球炎） — 眼睛發紅、疼痛、發粘、光敏感 嘴唇/嘴（唇炎、口腔炎） — 嘴唇發紅結痂、口腔潰瘍疼痛 咽部、食道 — 導致進食困難 生殖器區域和尿道 — 糜爛、潰瘍、尿瀦留 上呼吸道（氣管和呼吸道）支氣管）——咳嗽和呼吸困難胃腸道——腹瀉。病人病得很重，極度焦慮，而且非常痛苦。除了皮膚/粘膜受累外，其他器官也可能受到影響，包括肝臟、腎臟、肺、骨髓和關節。中毒性表皮壞死松解症 史蒂文斯約翰遜綜合症 史蒂文斯約翰遜綜合症
epidemiology_zh: SJS/TEN 是一種非常罕見的藥物使用並發症（估計 SJS 每年為 1-2/百萬人，TEN 每年為 0.4-1.2/百萬人）。任何接受藥物治療的人都可能不可預測地患上 SJS/TEN。它可以影響所有年齡段和所有種族。女性比男性略多見。與人類免疫缺陷病毒感染 (HIV) 相關的情況要常見 100 倍。遺傳因素很重要。在某些種族中，HLA 與抗驚厥藥和別嘌呤醇存在關聯。已檢測到特定基因的多態性（例如，抗驚厥藥反應患者中編碼細胞色素 P450 的 CYP2C）。據報導，有 200 多種藥物與 SJS/TEN 相關。與半衰期短的化學相似的相關藥物相比，半衰期長的藥物更常見。藥物的半衰期是一半所輸送劑量在體內保持循環的時間。這些藥物通常是全身性的（口服或註射），但也有 10 種局部使用後的報導。約 20% 的病例不涉及任何藥物 SJS/TEN 很少與疫苗接種和支原體和鉅細胞病毒等感染相關。感染通常與粘膜受累有關，並且與藥物引起的皮膚病相比，其皮膚病的嚴重程度要輕一些。最常引起 SJS/TEN 的藥物是抗生素，佔 40%。其他藥物包括： 磺胺類：複方新諾明 β-內酰胺類：青黴素類、頭孢菌素類 抗驚厥藥：拉莫三嗪、卡馬西平、苯妥英、苯巴比妥 別嘌呤醇 撲熱息痛/對乙酰氨基酚 奈韋拉平（非核苷類逆轉錄酶抑製劑） 非甾體抗炎藥（NSAID）（主要是昔康類）抗癌藥、PD-1抑製劑。SJS/TEN 的其他觸發器。
prognosis_zh: SJS/TEN 由於急性期並發症可能致命。SJS 的死亡率高達 10%，TEN 的死亡率至少為 30%。在急性期，潛在的致命並發症包括： 脫水和急性營養不良 皮膚、粘膜、肺部感染（肺炎）、細菌和念珠菌引起的敗血症（血液中毒） 急性呼吸窘迫綜合徵 胃腸道潰瘍、穿孔和腸套疊 休克和多器官衰竭，包括腎衰竭 血栓栓塞和瀰漫性血管內凝血病。

title: Telangiectasia
snippet: Telangiectasia refers to permanently dilated small blood vessels visible on the skin surface. They commonly appear as fine red lines or blanchable vessels.
causes: May be associated with chronic sun exposure, rosacea, ageing, systemic diseases, or previous skin injury. Some cases are idiopathic.
symptoms: Visible red or purple thread-like vessels on the skin. Usually asymptomatic but may cause cosmetic concern.
snippet_zh: 毛細血管擴張是指皮膚表面可見的永久性擴張小血管，常呈紅色細線或可壓退色的血管外觀。
causes_zh: 可能與日曬、酒糟、老化、全身性疾病或皮膚受傷後變化有關，也可能無明確原因。
symptoms_zh: 皮膚上可見細小紅色或紫色血管，一般無症狀，主要造成外觀困擾。

title: Telogen effluvium
snippet: Telogen effluvium is a non-scarring form of diffuse hair loss with no clinical or histological evidence of inflammation and can affect up to 50% of the scalp hair. The resting scalp club hairs remain firmly attached to the hair follicles at first. The new hairs coming up through the scalp push out t
causes: In a normal healthy person's scalp, about 85% of the hair follicles are actively growing hair (anagen hair) and about 15% are resting hair (telogen hair). A few hairs may also be in catagen. A hair follicle usually grows anagen hair for 4 years or so, then rests for about 4 months. A new anagen hair begins to grow under the resting telogen hair and pushes it out. Thus, it is normal to lose up to about 100 hairs a day on one's comb, brush, in the basin or on the pillow, as a result of the normal scalp hair cycle. If there is some shock to the system, as many as 70% of the anagen hairs can be precipitated into telogen, thus reversing the usual ratio. Typical triggers include: Childbirth: postpartum hair loss. This can resolve after a few months or transition into female pattern alopecia . Physiological neonatal hair loss Acute or chronic illness, especially if there is fever Surgical operation Accident Psychological stress Weight loss, unusual diet, or nutritional deficiency (eg, iron deficiency /) Certain medications Endocrine disorders (eg, hypothyroidism , hyperthyroidism ) Discontinuing the contraceptive pill Overseas travel resulting in jetlag Skin disease affecting the scalp (eg, erythroderma ) Excessive sun exposure.
symptoms: Telogen effluvium is a non-scarring form of diffuse hair loss with no clinical or histological evidence of inflammation and can affect up to 50% of the scalp hair. The resting scalp club hairs remain firmly attached to the hair follicles at first. The new hairs coming up through the scalp push out the resting club hairs and increased hair fall is noticed 2 to 4 months after the triggering event. Thus, paradoxically, with this type of hair loss, hair fall is a sign of hair regrowth. As the new hair first comes up through the scalp and pushes out the dead hair, a fine fringe of new hair is often evident along the forehead hairline. At first, the fall of club hairs is profuse and a general thinning of the scalp hair may become evident but after several months a peak is reached and hair fall begins to lessen, gradually tapering back to normal over 6–9 months in most cases. As the hair fall tapers off, the scalp thickens back up to normal, but recovery may be incomplete in some cases. Because nail and hair growth are under the same influences, an arrest in hair growth is often mirrored in the nails by a groove across them coinciding with the time of the shock to the system — a Beau line. The time of the shock can be estimated from the fact that a fingernail takes 5 months to grow from the posterior nail fold to the free edge. So if the groove in the nail is halfway down the nail, the shock must have been two and a half months ago. Beau line Beau line Beau line
epidemiology: Acute telogen effluvium can affect people of all age groups and both sexes. Chronic telogen effluvium with no clear precipitating cause tends to present in otherwise healthy women 30–60 years of age.
prognosis: Regrowth usually occurs after removal of the trigger causing telogen effluvium. However, repeated episodes of acute telogen effluvium can sometimes evolve into female pattern hair loss .

causes_zh: 在正常健康人的頭皮中，約 85% 的毛囊是活躍生長的頭髮（毛髮生長初期），約 15% 是靜止的毛髮（毛髮生長終期）。一些毛髮也可能處於退行期。毛囊通常會生長毛髮生長初期4年左右，然後休息約4個月。新的毛髮生長初期毛髮開始在休止期毛髮下方生長並將其推出。因此，由於正常的頭皮毛髮週期，每天在梳子、刷子、盆里或枕頭上脫落約 100 根頭髮是正常的。如果系統受到一些衝擊，多達 70% 的毛髮生長初期毛髮會沉澱到毛髮生長終期，從而扭轉通常的比例。典型的觸發因素包括： 分娩：產後脫髮。這可以在幾個月後消失或轉變為女性型脫髮。生理性新生兒脫髮 急性或慢性疾病，特別是發燒 外科手術 事故 心理壓力 體重減輕、飲食不正常或營養缺乏（例如缺鐵） 某些藥物 內分泌失調（例如甲狀腺功能減退、甲狀腺功能亢進） 停止服用避孕藥 海外旅行導致時差 影響頭皮的皮膚病（例如紅皮病） 過度日曬。
symptoms_zh: 休止期脫髮是一種無疤痕形式的瀰漫性脫髮，沒有炎症的臨床或組織學證據，可影響高達 50% 的頭皮毛髮。最初，靜止的頭皮俱樂部毛髮仍牢固地附著在毛囊上。觸發事件後 2 至 4 個月，從頭皮中長出的新毛髮將剩餘的毛髮推出，並且脫髮增加。因此，矛盾的是，對於這種類型的脫髮，脫髮是頭髮再生的標誌。當新頭髮首先從頭皮中長出來並將死發推出時，沿著前額髮際線通常會出現明顯的新頭髮細流。起初，球狀毛髮大量脫落，頭皮毛髮普遍稀疏，但幾個月後達到頂峰，毛髮脫落開始減少，在大多數情況下，在 6-9 個月內逐漸恢復正常。隨著頭髮脫落逐漸減少，頭皮變厚恢復正常，但在某些情況下恢復可能不完全。由於指甲和毛髮的生長受到相同的影響，毛髮生長的停滯通常通過指甲上的凹槽反映出來，該凹槽與系統受到衝擊的時間一致——博線。電擊時間可以根據指甲從後甲襞長到游離緣需要5個月的時間來估算。因此，如果指甲上的凹槽位於指甲的中間，那麼震動一定是在兩個半月前。博線 博線 博線
epidemiology_zh: 急性休止期脫髮可影響所有年齡段和男女。沒有明確誘因的慢性休止期脫髮往往出現在 30-60 歲健康的女性身上。
prognosis_zh: 再生通常發生在去除引起休止期脫髮的觸發因素後。然而，急性休止期脫髮的反復發作有時會演變成女性型脫髮。

title: Terminology in dermatology
snippet: A reference guide explaining common descriptive terms used in dermatology to classify skin lesions, including morphology, distribution, colour, and surface changes.
snippet_zh: 本頁提供常見皮膚科描述性術語的參考，包括皮膚病灶的形態、分布、顏色與表面變化等分類方式。

title: Tinea
snippet: Tinea refers to superficial fungal infections of the skin caused by dermatophytes, commonly affecting the body, scalp, feet, and groin.
causes: Tinea is caused by dermatophyte fungi such as Trichophyton, Microsporum, and Epidermophyton, which invade keratinised tissues of the skin, hair, or nails.
symptoms: Typical features include ring-shaped scaly patches, redness, itching, and sometimes central clearing. Tinea pedis presents with maceration and peeling between toes; tinea corporis shows circular plaques.
snippet_zh: 癬是一種由皮癬菌引起的表淺真菌感染，常見於身體、頭皮、腳部與鼠蹊部等部位。
causes_zh: 癬由皮癬菌，如毛癬菌屬、絮狀表皮癬菌屬與小孢子菌屬感染角質層、毛髮或指（趾）甲所致。
symptoms_zh: 常見表現為環狀脫屑、紅疹、搔癢，有時中央色淡。足癬會出現趾縫浸軟與脫皮，體癬則呈現圓形斑塊。

title: Tinea corporis
snippet: Tinea corporis initially presents as a solitary circular red patch with a raised scaly leading edge. A lesion spreads out from the centre forming a ring-shape with central hypopigmentation and a peripheral scaly red rim (ringworm). The border can be papular or pustular. Itch is common. With time, mu
causes: Tinea corporis is predominantly caused by dermatophyte fungi of the genera Trichophyton and Microsporum . The anthropophilic species T. rubrum is the most common causative agent of tinea corporis worldwide including New Zealand. Other species that may cause tinea corporis include: T. interdigitale T. tonsurans — secondary to tinea capitis or skin-to-skin contact M. canis (cats, dogs), and less commonly other zoonotic species including T. verrucosum (cattle), T. equinum (horses) and T. erinacei (hedgehogs). Tinea corporis is spread by the shedding of fungal spores from infected skin. Transmission is facilitated by a warm, moist environment and the sharing of fomites including bedding, towels, and clothing. Dermatophyte infection elsewhere on the skin, such as tinea pedis, can also be transferred. The incubation period is 1–3 weeks. The dermatophyte invades and spreads in the stratum corneum , but is unable to penetrate deeper layers in healthy skin.
symptoms: Tinea corporis initially presents as a solitary circular red patch with a raised scaly leading edge. A lesion spreads out from the centre forming a ring-shape with central hypopigmentation and a peripheral scaly red rim (ringworm). The border can be papular or pustular. Itch is common. With time, multiple lesions can develop which may coalesce to form a polycyclic pattern. The distribution of lesions is typically asymmetrical. Sharp red scaly margin of tinea corporis Papules and pustules of tinea corporis Asymmetry of tinea corporis See also Tinea corporis images
epidemiology: Tinea corporis is found in most parts of the world, but particularly in hot humid climates. It is most commonly seen in children and young adults, however all age groups can be infected including newborns. Medical risk factors include: Previous or concurrent tinea infection Diabetes mellitus Immunodeficiency Hyperhidrosis Xerosis Ichthyosis. Environmental risk factors include: Household crowding Infection of household members Keeping house pets Wearing occlusive clothing Recreational activities involving close contact with others including shared change rooms. A genetic predisposition has been postulated, particularly for tinea imbricata.
prognosis: Tinea corporis is contagious, spreading elsewhere on the skin and to others. Immunosuppressed patients, such as those with HIV/AIDS , can present with disseminated infection. Chronic dermatophytosis is T. rubrum infection of at least four body sites following a prolonged fluctuating course and recurrence despite treatment. Dermatophytide reactions are an allergic rash at a distant site caused by an inflammatory fungal infection. Secondary bacterial infection with Staph aureus is common in children with atopic dermatitis and tinea corporis.
